story:
Just a reminder for all my donors that I am writing updates as I have them on my blog, A Soldier's Perspective.   I wanted to take a quick moment and provide an update here in the hopes everyone left an email address and will get this update.

Currently, we are in a holding patter.  The city has still not given up the dashcam footage to my attorney who requested it weeks ago.  This reeks of cover-up to me.  We anticipate the charges will be dropped soon - something that should have been done long ago. 

I have retained attorney Brett Pritchard in Killeen to handle the civil case against the officers, police department, and city.  Kurt Glass is still handling my criminal case.  I have also hired a very good private investigator and expert witness on police procedure.  He has over 19 years of service in various roles of law enforcement, but I don't want to release his name yet. 

If there is any money left over from this campaign, it will go into either a trust to help other local Soldiers dealing with being illegally disarmed or sent to a gun rights group like Gun Owners of America or Texas State Rifle Association.

Again, thank you for your support.

 

I've written and update to my case on my blog here:

http://asp.militarygear.com/2013/04/18/the-hard-right-over-the-easy-wrong/

I will also be providing updates on my blog, A Soldier's Perspective.

Please email me at: cj@soldiersperspective.us

 

UPDATE3 (12 April 2013: Clips from the video my son took of the incident were released and the Daily Caller has them up on their site.

Video of the incident obtained by The Daily Caller shows officers defending their behavior to Grisham while restraining him.

“In this day and age, [people] are alarmed when they see someone with what you have,” one of the officers tells Grisham in the video. “They don’t care what the law is.”

Grisham, who is stationed at Fort Hood, was arrested in his hometown of Temple, Texas, east of the base, after police stopped him for carrying an unconcealed rifle slung over his shoulder. Texas is a right-to-carry state, and law-abiding gun permit owners can carry rifles and hunting weapons openly, so long as the weapons are not being carried in a threatening way.

But one of the Temple police officers told Grisham that anyone holding a gun is considered dangerous, according to the video.

“When you alarm people, and they call us,” one of the officers in the video begins to say, after Grisham asks why the officiers failed to ask for his concealed-carry permit.

“And did you explain to them what the law is, sir?” Grisham asks.

“They don’t care what the law is,” the officer replies. Grisham then shoots back, “Do you care what the law is?”

Read more: http://dailycaller.com/2013/04/12/police-anti-gun-prosecutor-clash-with-soldiers-in-area-around-fort-hood-video/#ixzz2QGpIL4ZC

 

UPDATE2 (4 April 2013): One of the local stations did a story on my case that I wanted to share with you.  If the video html doesn't work, click here.

 

Charge reduced against man hiking with gun in Temple

BY DEBORAH MCKEON | TELEGRAM STAFF

Wednesday, Apr 3, 2013 4:30 AM

The charge against Christopher Grisham, who was arrested after police found him carrying a rifle while hiking with his son, was changed from resisting arrest — a Class A misdemeanor — to interrupting, disrupting, impeding and interfering with a peace officer while performing a duty, a Class B misdemeanor.

The original charge said a call came in of two men walking along the road, termed “suspicious males,” in the area of Airport Road and Old Howard Road. One appeared to be armed, according to the police report provided by Cpl. Christopher Wilcox, Temple Police spokesman.

 

 

UPDATE (1 April 2013): My attorney received the incident reports and official charges from the DA today.  The "resisting arrest" (class A misdemeanor) charge has disappeared and been replaced with "interference with public duties" (class B misdemeanor) charge.  Neither charge is cause for taking my firearms and they still have not been returned.  Now that we have official charges and incident reports, more information will be released this week.  I am completely innocent of this and all charges and time will show that I did nothing wrong besides stand up for my rights as an American.

 I am an active duty Soldier and veteran of Iraq and Afghanistan.  I'm a concealed handgun license holder in several states.  I have never in my life been charged with a crime.  I live in the country and love to shoot.  I strongly believe in the Constitution and the rights guaranteed by it. 

While out hiking with my son through back country roads to help him earn his Eagle Scout rank, I was illegally arrested and disarmed without cause. I was thrown in jail and my lawfully owned weapons were confiscated without receipt or notice.  

This shouldn't happen in the United States of America, much less the State of Texas.  

 

By helping me fight for my rights, you are helping to fight for the rights of all Americans!

No one should have to fear being illegally disarmed without warrant, especially someone who has never committed a crime in his life.  There is an overt attempt to disarm Americans, and especially veterans, in this country.  

I live on a military salary and my wife had to use our savings to bail me out of jail so I didn't have to spend an entire weekend waiting on the magistrate to enjoy his/hers.  So, I need help fighting for my rights.  I can't afford the $10,000 retainer to hire a good lawyer familiar with these issues.  

My attorney is Mr. Kurt Glass, an attorney at law and fellow US Army veteran.  If you'd like to contact him directly, his email is kurtwglass@gmail.com to verify the specifics of my case.  His website is www.kurtwglasslaw.com.  

This campaign is not endorsed, affiliated, supported, or in any way supported by the DOD, United States Army, or any branch or unit of government.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with like-minded gun owners and patriots and ask them to support me.  This case has state-wide and national implications.  

UPDATE:  The Temple Daily Telegram published the following story about this case.  As more information is made public, I will add it to the page here.  Unfortunately, it costs $1 to read the entire article but does not refute my claims here.  

http://www.tdtnews.com/index/news/show/98500?ti...

Weapons confiscated: Man, charged with resisting arrest, wants his guns back

BY DEBORAH MCKEON | TELEGRAM STAFF
Sunday, Mar 24, 2013 4:30 AM

 

Christopher J. Grisham, 39, has an issue with Temple Police after they stopped him and his son on a Boy Scout hike, disarmed and arrested him, his attorney says. Officers say he resisted arrest. 

Now the U.S. Army counterintelligence agent wants Temple Police to return the rifle and handgun they confiscated from him. 

Grisham was arrested March 16, five days after he urged the Temple City Council to declare that citizen rights to keep and bear arms will not be infringed upon.

story:
NB: Due to the slow pace of donations, we may need until spring 2012 to finish the series.

You can help a team of libertarian activists and artists give America a liberty upgrade this summer. We're creating 18 libertarian pamphlets on the pressing issues of the day and distributing them across the nation. For every dollar you invest, we expect to reach as many as 8,491 people - up to 1.6 million total. Join us! Don't miss this opportunity to have an impact of historical proportions. Share our project with your friends, donate in return for perks and become a distributor in your community. The time is now. Thank you!


Who

YOU, artist Meg McLain, editor Stephanie Murphy, an unlimited number of pamphlet distributors and me, organizer/writer George Donnelly.


What

I want to give 300 million Americans a liberty upgrade. I want to help 300 million people evolve one level closer to understanding and appreciating their liberty and innate equality with every other human being on this planet. I call this project Op Common Sense.

We are creating a series of 18 gorgeous liberty-oriented pamphlets (see the first one below). We will then distribute these pamphlets across the country. We expect to distribute up to 16,000 pamphlets per week in as many as 100 American cities, giving us a potential reach of 1.6 million Americans and a total distribution of as many as 30 million eye-catching slices of liberty.


When

July through October, 2011.


Where

America, you know, that country with 50 states.


Why

Times are desperate. This country is falling apart. We've got wars, inflation, unemployment, domestic oppression, loss of privacy and dignity, disrespect for human rights and rising poverty. The liberty message is not getting out there and it shows every time you have a discussion with a non-libertarian. We have a historic opportunity to right this, to foster a liberty-sensitive populace. Together we can roll all of this back and create space for human freedom.

How

We're trading some really unique and valuable perks in return for the cost of producing the copyright-free pamphlets. Distributors in cities across the country can sell the 3 ad spaces on the pamphlets in order to fund their printing and other expenses. For example, a local liberty group in your area could sell the two bigger ads for $400 each per week. You could spend $500 to buy roughly 10,000 pamphlets and, with the remaining $300 per week, hire someone to hand them out.


Draft First Pamphlet

This is a draft of our first pamphlet.




Hi-res front and back.


Where's the Money Going?

Graphic Design: $2350. Artist Meg McLain cut her normal rate in half and is doing the graphic design for each of the 18 pamphlets at $125 each. Meg is also creating a logo for $100.

Writing and Perks: $900. George Donnelly (me) is writing the pamphlets. I am requesting $50 per pamphlet. The $900 will be spent on fulfilling perks and purchasing pamphlets for distribution.

Editing: $0. Stephanie Murphy is an experienced writer who is taking a perk in return for her services.

Volunteers: $0. At least a dozen talented individuals are volunteering as writers, researchers and editors for personal satisfaction and/or perks.

Fees: $283. I'm throwing in about 8% for card processing and the Indiegogo fee.

$2350 + $900 = $3250 + 8% == $3,533

So what?

This project has the potential to put as many as 30 million liberty-advocating pamphlets in the hands of Americans this summer and fall. We could reach up to 8,491 people for every dollar contributed. Can you beat that return on investment?

A Historic Impact

Given the financial crises, the multiple foreign wars, possible further financial shocks, the deteriorating state of education, the health care debate, the higher-than-ever national debt, record unemployment and higher-than-ever rates of public dissatisfaction with the status quo, our chance to influence the national conversation with a historic impact has arrived. We are facing a crisis, and in every crisis lies the seed of opportunity.

Our Unique Opportunity

We need to grasp our unique opportunity to put truth in the hands of millions of our countrymen. A more liberty-sensitive populace could force existing politicians towards greater respect for liberty, roll back the police state, help elect libertarians to state office and, most importantly, expand the space for liberty in our lives so you might live with more joy and less tyranny.

Stop the Tide of Statism

If we do not make outreach projects like this happen, the cause of liberty will have missed its unique historic opportunity to stop the tide of statism and advance the cause of human rights and liberty.

Showcase of Liberty

This project is a showcase of liberty. Not only does it explain and promote liberty, it also utilizes libertarian principles. It is a decentralized effort in which anyone can participate to the extent they want. In order to fund the project, we are trading with you, free-market-style. You can even make money as a distributor. This project builds the libertarian economy while also expanding the reach of libertarian ideas and proving that liberty works.

We Can do it Again Next Year

If this project is fruitful, and I am confident it will be, we will almost certainly repeat it next year. Thus, your investment will continue to reap dividends year after year as we reach more and more people with a message of freedom.


Become a Distributor

You can be a distributor in your community. Hand the pamphlets out to friends, families, co-workers, neighbors, at book stores, coffee shops and on street corners for fun and profit! Sell the ad spaces to local liberty organizations or small businesses in order to raise funds for printing costs and other expenses. Resell pamphlets to other liberty-lovers in your area, so they, in turn, can also distribute them. If you run a libertarian group or meetup, this is a perfect way to gain new members. If you want to be a distributor, contact me at me@georgedonnelly.com.

I will make printed copies of the pamphlets available to you for distribution at as low a price as possible. I will use any additional funds raised beyond $3,533 to defray the cost of pamphlets for distribution. For every dollar invested above this, you can put a little slice of liberty into the hands of 15-20 Americans.

What are these Pamphlets About?

The series starts with an introductory pamphlet about liberty (see below). The following pamphlets cover these topics:

  1.     Education: "Why our Schools are Broken"
  2.     Corporations
  3.     Oil
  4.     Environment
  5.     Central Banking
  6.     Taxes
  7.     The National Debt
  8.     Unemployment
  9.     Foreign War and Domestic Oppression
  10.     The Police State
  11.     The Monopoly Court System
  12.     Prisons and Punishment
  13.     The Database Society
  14.     Internet Restrictions
  15.     Health Care
  16.     Bankrupt State and Local Governments

The last pamphlet is to be determined. We can add up to 2 more if there is demand (see the Champion perk).

Bitcoin Donations

Using Bitcoin? Send us your donations to 13Kx18WTqXQEHwPQ3VMvQA8hLZ9mjCg4bV. I will also be taking precious metal donations at PorcFest 2011.

understanding and appreciating their liberty and innate equality with 
every other human being on this planet. I call this project Op Common 
Sense.We are creating a series of 18 gorgeous liberty-oriented pamphlets (see the first one below). We will then distribute these pamphlets across the country. We expect to distribute up to 16,000 pamphlets per week in as many as 100 American cities, giving us a potential reach of 1.6 million Americans and a total distribution of as many as 30 million eye-catching slices of liberty.WhenJuly through October, 2011.WhereAmerica, you know, that country with 50 states.WhyTimes are desperate. This country is falling apart. We've got wars, inflation, unemployment, domestic oppression, loss of privacy and dignity, disrespect for human rights and rising poverty. The liberty message is not getting out there and it shows every time you have a discussion with a non-libertarian. We have a historic opportunity to right this, to foster a liberty-sensitive populace. Together we can roll all of this back and create space for human freedom.HowWe're trading some really unique and valuable perks in return for the cost of producing the copyright-free pamphlets. Distributors in cities across the country can sell the 3 ad spaces on the pamphlets in order to fund their printing and other expenses. For example, a local liberty group in your area could sell the two bigger ads for $400 each per week. You could spend $500 to buy roughly 10,000 pamphlets and, with the remaining $300 per week, hire someone to hand them out.Draft First PamphletThis is a draft of our first pamphlet.Hi-res front and back.Where's the Money Going?
Graphic Design: $2350. Artist Meg McLain cut her normal rate in half and is doing the graphic design for each of the 18 pamphlets at $125 each. Meg is also creating a logo for $100.Writing and Perks: $900. George Donnelly (me) is writing the pamphlets. I am requesting $50 per pamphlet. The $900 will be spent on fulfilling perks and purchasing pamphlets for distribution.Editing: $0. Stephanie Murphy is an experienced writer who is taking a perk in return for her services.Volunteers: $0. At least a dozen talented individuals are volunteering as writers, researchers and editors for personal satisfaction and/or perks.Fees: $283. I'm throwing in about 8% for card processing and the Indiegogo fee.$2350 + $900 = $3250 + 8% == $3,533So what?This project has the potential to put as many as 30 million liberty-advocating pamphlets in the hands of Americans this summer and fall. We could reach up to 8,491 people for every dollar contributed. Can you beat that return on investment?A Historic ImpactGiven the financial crises, the multiple foreign wars, possible further financial shocks, the deteriorating state of education, the health care debate, the higher-than-ever national debt, record unemployment and higher-than-ever rates of public dissatisfaction with the status quo, our chance to influence the national conversation with a historic impact has arrived. We are facing a crisis, and in every crisis lies the seed of opportunity.Our Unique Opportunity
We need to grasp our unique opportunity to put truth in the hands of millions of our countrymen. A more liberty-sensitive populace could force existing politicians towards greater respect for liberty, roll back the police state, help elect libertarians to state office and, most importantly, expand the space for liberty in our lives so you might live with more joy and less tyranny.Stop the Tide of StatismIf we do not make outreach projects like this happen, the cause of liberty will have missed its unique historic opportunity to stop the tide of statism and advance the cause of human rights and liberty.Showcase of LibertyThis project is a showcase of liberty. Not only does it explain and promote liberty, it also utilizes libertarian principles. It is a decentralized effort in which anyone can participate to the extent they want. In order to fund the project, we are trading with you, free-market-style. You can even make money as a distributor. This project builds the libertarian economy while also expanding the reach of libertarian ideas and proving that liberty works.We Can do it Again Next YearIf this project is fruitful, and I am confident it will be, we will almost certainly repeat it next year. Thus, your investment will continue to reap dividends year after year as we reach more and more people with a message of freedom.Become a DistributorYou can be a distributor in your community. Hand the pamphlets out to friends, families, co-workers, neighbors, at book stores, coffee shops and on street corners for fun and profit! Sell the ad spaces to local liberty organizations or small businesses in order to raise funds for printing costs and other expenses. Resell pamphlets to other liberty-lovers in your area, so they, in turn, can also distribute them. If you run a libertarian group or meetup, this is a perfect way to gain new members. If you want to be a distributor, contact me at me@georgedonnelly.com.I will make printed copies of the pamphlets available to you for distribution at as low a price as possible. I will use any additional funds raised beyond $3,533 to defray the cost of pamphlets for distribution. For every dollar invested above this, you can put a little slice of liberty into the hands of 15-20 Americans.What are these Pamphlets About?The series starts with an introductory pamphlet about liberty (see below). The following pamphlets cover these topics:
    Education: "Why our Schools are Broken"
    Corporations

    Oil
    Environment
    Central Banking
    Taxes
    The National Debt
    Unemployment
    Foreign War and Domestic Oppression
    The Police State
    The Monopoly Court System
    Prisons and Punishment
    The Database Society
    Internet Restrictions
    Health Care
    Bankrupt State and Local Governments
The last pamphlet is to be determined. We can add up to 2 more if there is demand (see the Champion perk).Bitcoin DonationsUsing Bitcoin? Send us your donations to 13Kx18WTqXQEHwPQ3VMvQA8hLZ9mjCg4bV. I will also be taking precious metal donations at PorcFest 2011.

story:
Our Story

Thailand's human-traffickers exploit and desecrate destitute children. These children deserve more than our outrage. They deserve direct and deliberate help. I am volunteering with a Social Activism program called Justifi that works to save impoverished children in Thailand from human trafficking and sexual exploitation. Justifi partners with The Sold Project and The Volunteers for Children Development Foundation to build a better world, not just imagine one. The volunteer program is for people who believe that they have a role to play in ending hunger, suffering, and exploitation. It's for people who believe in the power of here and now to make this world a better place. 

It's for people who know that outrage is not enough, that real action is the solution. It's for people who want to be an active part of that solution.


The Impact

Our aim is to intercept destitute children from human-traffickers and to ensure their fundamental human rights.

We provide emergency assistance for street children to meet their basic needs and equip them with the means to protect themselves against sexual exploitation and HIV/AIDS. We provide education and other vocational skill development. Life skills are built and developed, like creative and critical thinking, decision-making and problem-solving.  In addition, we provide assistance with nationality registration so these neglected children can obtain ID cards. 


What We Need & What You Get

I am an independent volunteer and I have been awarded a scholarship to participate in Justifi's upcoming humanitarian mission. The scholarship excludes airfare, which is approximately $1,200 from Tel Aviv (where I am a student) to Bangkok. I am fundraising so that I can seize this opportunity to help children that have been grossly mistreated and tragically ignored. With your help, I will be able to actively protect children who deserve immediate intervention, not indifference. Thank you for your care and concern.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help by spreading the word and donating to other organizations combatting human trafficking. Check out the following websites for examples of ways to help:

 http://thesoldproject.com 

http://www.assetcampaign.org/

http://justifi.org/index.html

story:
The current reentry process from jail and prison has resulted in unacceptable recidivism rates, negatively impacting public safety in almost every community in the United States.  It is time to try something different.

The documentary Beyond The Wall follows five formerly incarcerated men who are attempting to rebuild their lives outside prison. These “Second Chance Citizens” leave prison not only with a criminal record, but frequently with a history of opiate addiction. In fact, according to the National Institutes of Health, former prisoners are 12 times as likely to die from an opiate overdose than the general population. This is largely due to the lack of a strong recovery support system upon release.

Louie Diaz and Billy Cabrera, former prisoners themselves, work to help provide that support, starting with a simple mantra: “If you continue doing what you’ve always done, you’ll continue getting what you’ve always gotten.” As detailed by Producer/Directors Jenny Phillips and Bestor Cram in Beyond The Wall, Diaz and Cabrera inspire and provoke while acknowledging the often-brutal reality of drug addiction and post-release life.

Since its completion, Beyond The Wall has received acclaim at film festivals around the U.S., and screened for hundreds of former prisoners, correctional officers, judges, attorneys and police officers. In 2018, the Beyond The Wall team will launch an 8-session educational re-entry program in prisons nationwide to help participants use stories from the film as well as their personal stories to build the skills, confidence and resilience necessary to navigate the many challenges and obstacles encountered when leaving prison.

But we can only make this important program a reality with your help. If we can successfully raise $25,000, Beyond The Wall and its corresponding social impact campaign will have the opportunity to transform thousands of lives.

 

The Getting Beyond the Wall Curriculum brings together three components: 

1) A strong group process built upon confidentiality, trust and shared respect.

2) Building awareness and mind-body skills to manage stress, and work with and regulate emotions.

3) A storytelling model emphasizing understanding one’s past and building a vision story for the future all in the process of group discussion.

story:
(SMEAC)

Situation:

Veterans are killing themselves at a rate of 22 per day.  More veterans have died by their own hands in both 2012 and 2013 than we lost in combat.  To repeat for emphasis - more veterans have died by their own hands in both 2012 and 2013 than we lost in combat.

Mission: to raise awareness by sharing the faces behind the staggering statistic of "22" veteran suicides that average every day.   

Execution/Objective: Team #22KILL is headed from Dallas to Boston.

Administrative and Logistics: 4 Marines

Oscar Mike 0600 Friday July 18-July 25, 2014.

Communication:                                                                                                                                  Team #22KILL will post text/pics/video updates on HCC's facebook page to share the entire trip.        

What is #22KILL?                                                                                                                             #22KILL is a program under a veteran nonprofit organization based in Dallas, TX called Honor Courage Commitment, Inc. The #22KILL initiative is to simply show your ongoing support for the U.S. military and the veterans who have served. You can do this by wearing our Matte Black Tungsten #22KILL trademarked band on your right index finger. This is what we call a "silent salute".

When you see someone with this ring on, please make it a point to shake that person's hand because you share a common love and respect for those who serve(d). Often times it's warriors themselves who wear the Honor Ring™ with pride in honor of his/her comrades. In this case, the ring just did it's job because you shook a veteran's hand.

Do I have to be in the military to wear an Honor Ring™?

No you do not. Any person who supports those who serve(d) (active warriors, veterans, friends and family members) can show their appreciation and say "thank you" with a "silent salute" by wearing an Honor Ring™ on the right index finger. It is worn on the right index finger because (when capable) we only salute with the right hand.

Why is it called #22KILL?

There's a staggering statistic that 22 veterans commit suicide everyday.  It's important that we raise awareness around this fact so that we can all do our part to alleviate this epidemic.

How can I help?

Proceeds go to Honor Courage Commitment, Inc. (official 501c3 tax-exempt charitable organization).  HCC has a holistic approach to helping veterans transition more smoothly.  By having an actionable plan, preferably prior to leaving the service,  veterans are more likely to never fall into a what we call a "downward spiral" - unemployment, underutilized, loss of identity, depressed, drug abuse, stereotyped negatively, and leading to the ultimate loss - suicide.

For the past 3 years, HCC has helped veterans find a "sense of purpose" after serving in the military by focusing on education, mentorship, and community service.  HCC creates elite veterans.  By leveraging the valuable skill sets instilled in our veterans to make positive impacts in the community, this continues our veterans' "sense of purpose" after serving, which embodies our ethos of  "service after service."

Why Education?

Most veterans earn the GI Bill which is basically a full ride to school.  It is absurd not to use it.  College may not be for everyone, but there are many other options in education that can be more fitting to the veteran; ie trade schools, certifications, etc.

Why a Mentor?

Whether you were a private or general in the in service, you always had a higher rank or someone that held you accountable.  After transitioning out of the military, a qualified mentor who aligns with your goals can be your next battle buddy.  The mentor not only holds you accountable to your goals, but can open doors and make introductions for you in business.  The mentor can also be a person for you to confide in that can listen and provide valuable advice and make connections.

Why Community Service?

Serving in the military can give veterans a heightened sense of purpose.  There is not anything more honorable than serving others and by utilizing the skill sets already instilled in veterans (leadership, team building/management, logistics, etc), everyone wins - local communities get to reap the benefits from the talents of our trained assets and the veterans get to continue serving - maintining their identity and sense of purpose.  For more info please feel free to visit HCC's main website: www.veteran.me

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone is in a position to give financially, but may still want to support #22KILL.  One of the easiest and best things that you could do for us is to simply use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.  This makes a huge impact in our MISSION: "To honor those who serve and to raise awareness around the 22 veteran suicides that avg every day."

*Any surplus of funds will be allocated to HCC's programs to empower veterans.

story:
The mission of FEMEN is development of the leadership, intellectual and moral qualities of the women in the whole world. Our main weapon is brave non-stoppable topless protests.

During last years, FEMEN has been internationally recognized for topless protests against sexism, patriarchy, homophobia, and other social, national and international seeks.

Where others meet fears – we act. Where others keep silence –we raise our voice. You definitely have seen us at the news with peaceful topless attack to Putin, Lukashenko, Berlusconi and others XXI century dictators. We acted at Davos Forum, Pope Election at Vatican, Russian president election at Moscow, gay-marriage manifests at Paris, keeping attention from millions via news at newspapers, internet media and TV. Our activists bring protests even in Islamic countries, in spite of threats of violence, imprisonment and death penalty.

If you want to know more, search youtube for femen, read our blog at official site femen.us, stay with us at our facebook pages www.facebook.com/francefemen, www.facebook.com/femengermany

For today, we extend our presence worldwide, opening of headquarters France, Germany, Eastern Europe and supporting our activists in various countries, including Middle East region.

Where Your Donation Goes

We are non-profit public organization. To keep our independence and freedom, from the very beginning our source of funds was donations from our supporters and branded merchandise sales at FEMEN e-shop.

Today we need your help to keep our movement for the women rights around the world.

Thanks for Your Donation

We really appreciate any amount of your donation, however we have created a special perks for donation at $70:

·        You will get a handmade boobsprint with sign from one of the most known FEMEN activist.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not anyone ready to donate, so there are other ways you can help:

·        Like and share our pages at Facebook:

·        www.facebook.com/francefemen

·        www.facebook.com/femengermany

·        Share this ask for donation with your friends

·        Buy ourbranded t-shirt, cup or boobsprint

Sincerely,

Your FEMEN

story:
Donate to the Dallas Life shelter and provide housing, food and clothing for homeless children and their families over Easter.  In return, you’ll receive a virtual “Easter Greeting” from those you helped. 

This is not just any “Easter Greeting.”  Depending upon your level of donation, you can have a custom picture or video message created by a Dallas Life resident.  You can choose wording and have it addressed to your loved ones, family or friend.

Imagine the impact of helping homeless children this Easter.  Then imagine the impact of sharing that moment in a personalized message.  For our Indigogo campaign, you can deeply impact a homeless child you don’t know and someone you do – for Easter.

Dallas Life is the most effective homeless shelter in the US. The recovery program boasts an impressive 68% success rate (the national average is 6%) and offers private rooms to families. You're not just providing food, clothing and shelter -- you're paving the way to get children off the streets for good! 

Here's a peek at a "Virtual Easter Greeting from the Homeless." (This is our $150 'Personalized Easter Video' Incentive.) Scroll down to see more samples of each incentive package! Let's change the face of Easter!


If you celebrate NEW LIFE at EASTER, now you can offer it to others in a practical way!

Did you know that families with children are the fastest growing homeless demographic in the US? That’s why we’re raising $17,125 to help 66 homeless children and their parents (103 people) from Palm Sunday through Easter Sunday. Our goal breaks down to $23.75 per person, per night, for 7 nights (rounded up). The price includes meals, laundry, childcare, medical, dental, and a comprehensive recovery program including AA, job skills, counseling, budgeting, resume writing and one-on-one mentoring.

See how this daily rate compares to alternatives:
Price of Dallas Prison      $100/night
Price of Mental Hospital  $320/night
Cheapest Motel in Dallas    $35/night 

*Does not include meals, laundry, childcare, medical/dental, or recovery.

Dallas Life Homeless Shelter  $23.75/night   *All Inclusive!

Our unique perks will change the face of Easter!

Goodbye, Easter Bunny! Hello, real people with lives that really matter.

Our incentive packages range from $10-$150+ for a virtual Easter greeting from a Dallas Life resident.  The more you donate, the more you can personalize the message! Be sure to share the love with your friends and family!

No matter how much you spend - even if you spend nothing - you can still help #DallasLife by spreading the word! Follow us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter and tag your friends. 

Q: How can I personalize my Easter Greeting through Indiegogo?
A:  First, create an Indiegogo account and donate to our campaign. When you donate, Indiegogo will prompt you to provide your email address. We will contact you via email to confirm your 'In Honor' or 'Personalized' message according to the incentive package you purchase. Below are sample videos and photos to inspire you!

Sample: Personalized Easter Video $150
*Personalize your Easter message. Just let us know what it should say!


Sample: 'Happy Easter' Card (Photo) $10


Sample: "In Honor" Easter Video $100
Make a donation "In Honor" of your loved ones, or ask us to name a specific person.


Sample: 'Happy Easter' Video (Generic) $20

Sample: Happy Easter Video (Group)  $20


Sample: "In Honor" Easter Photo $50


Sample: Personalized Easter Photo  $60

At Dallas Life, we love Jesus and people. That's why we want to honor Easter by taking care of the people Jesus cares about. This Holy Week, celebrate New Life with us in a practical way. Thank you! Happy Easter! And, God bless!

FAQ

Q: What if I have questions about the campaign?
A:  Thank you for your interest. Just email us, dallaslifeshelter@gmail.com

Q: What if I want to donate, but I don't want a perk?
A: No problem. When you donate, Indiegogo will let you opt-out of receiving a perk.

Q: Can I donate via check?
A: Absolutley! Make your check payable to 'Dallas Life.' Mail to: 1100 Cadiz St, Dallas, TX, 75215. You'll receive a tax donation receipt in the mail.

impact a homeless child you don’t know and someone you do – for Easter.
Dallas Life is the most effective homeless shelter in the US. The recovery program boasts an impressive 68% success
rate (the national average is 6%) and offers private rooms to families. You're
not just providing food, clothing and shelter -- you're paving the way to get
children off the streets for good!  
Here's a peek at a "Virtual Easter Greeting from the Homeless." (This is our $150 'Personalized Easter Video' Incentive.) Scroll down to see more samples of each incentive package! Let's change the face of Easter!
If you celebrate NEW LIFE at EASTER, now you can offer it to others in a practical way! 

 Did you know that
families with children are the fastest growing homeless demographic in the US? That’s why we’re raising $17,125 to help 66 homeless children and their parents (103 people) from Palm Sunday through Easter Sunday. Our goal breaks down to $23.75 per person, per night, for 7 nights (rounded up). The price includes meals, laundry, childcare, medical, dental, and a comprehensive recovery program including AA, job skills, counseling, budgeting, resume writing and one-on-one mentoring. See how this daily rate compares to alternatives:Price of Dallas Prison      $100/nightPrice of Mental Hospital  $320/nightCheapest Motel in Dallas    $35/night  *Does not include meals, laundry, childcare, medical/dental,
or recovery.
Dallas Life Homeless Shelter  $23.75/night   *All Inclusive! 

Our unique perks will change the face of Easter!
Goodbye, Easter Bunny! Hello, real people with lives that really matter. Our incentive packages range from $10-$150+ for a virtual Easter greeting from a Dallas Life resident.  The more you donate, the more you can personalize the message! Be sure to share the love with your friends and family!No matter how much you spend - even if you spend nothing - you can still help #DallasLife by spreading the word! Follow us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter and tag your friends.  Q: How can I personalize my Easter Greeting through Indiegogo?A:  First, create an Indiegogo account and donate to our campaign. When you donate, Indiegogo will prompt you to provide your email address. We will contact you via email to confirm your 'In Honor' or 'Personalized' message according to the incentive package you purchase. Below are sample videos and photos to inspire you!Sample: Personalized Easter Video $150*Personalize your Easter message. Just let us know what it should say!Sample: 'Happy Easter' Card (Photo) $10


Sample: "In Honor" Easter Video $100Make a donation "In Honor" of your loved ones, or ask us to name a specific person. 
Sample: 'Happy Easter' Video (Generic) $20Sample: Happy Easter Video (Group)  $20Sample: "In Honor" Easter Photo $50

Sample: Personalized Easter Photo  $60

At Dallas Life, we love Jesus and people. That's why we want to honor Easter by taking care of the people Jesus cares about. This Holy Week, celebrate New Life with us in a practical way. Thank you! Happy Easter! And, God bless!FAQ
Q: What if I have questions about the campaign?A:  Thank you for your interest. Just email us, dallaslifeshelter@gmail.comQ: What if I want to donate, but I don't want a perk?
A: No problem. When you donate, Indiegogo will let you opt-out of receiving a perk. Q: Can I donate via check?A: Absolutley! Make your check payable to 'Dallas Life.' Mail to: 1100 Cadiz St, Dallas, TX, 75215. You'll receive a tax donation receipt in the mail.

story:
- Short Summary

You will see in our video the heart wrenching impact of what happens when a young child finds a loaded gun. Take a moment to look and imagine the impact of a gun accident on your family or friends. Can we change this? You bet we can. With your help and your contributions a new patent pending invention can be brought forth that will quickly (half second) defend the family and protect small children from gun accidents. No finger print reading, tags, rings, etc. are needed to make a gun ready to safely defend the family, nothing.Take a moment to look deeper to see how you and we can make this happen. This new invention is SAAMO™-SR (Safety Round) where compromise is not an option. It's your call.

If after the short summary and video you want to drill deeper, click on the following.

http://www.bing.com/videos/search?q=20+20+young+kids+and+guns&FORM=VIRE4#view=detail&mid=5CA87CC6D8B801F4FFE75CA87CC6D8B801F4FFE7

- Begin saving lives by teaming up with us now.

Can we count on your donation to help protect all using SAAMO™-SR , especially families with young children. You can make donations of any amounts and/or enjoy some discount perks when SAAMO™-SR  becomes available.

A most important part of crowd funding is where you return to your invitation email and share our Indiegogo campaign with your family and friends and they with there family and friends, so on and so on.

For FACEBOOK sharing, connect by EVERLOKT and share from there.

Together you, your friends and we can make this happen.


- Technology (Want to go deeper still?)

SAAMO™-SR (Safety Round) is a patent pending technology in development that is unique to gun technology where a bullet blocking scheme combined with a tamper warning system saves lives, simple. Also SAAMO™-SR is a criminal negative weapons system which benefits all but the criminal, unless they have small children.

Funds collected herein will be used to develop the SAAMO™-SR (Safety Round) which is a safety device and derivative of SAAMO™, our core ammunition technology. Visit out technology site www.saamotm.com for more information on this unique ammunition technology.

- What We Need

The campaign target is for $50,000, an important target of which is to achieve 30% of the target amount. When 30% of target is reached we have been advised we can explore press releases to further enhance crowd funding. The funds will be for engineering development and fabrication of pre-manufacturing prototypes. This target funding will take the project to a working prototype wherein investor and grant funds will be sought to bring SAAMO™-SR to market. Funds in excess of this target will determine the rate that SAAMO™-SR can be brought to market in combination with other funds. The goal is simple, make this SAAMO™-SR device commercially available to defend and protect families

- What Contributors Get

The Indiegogo terms of use prohibit offering firearm related items directly as a perk. SAAMO™-SR vouchers can and are being offered that allows for discounts from merchants selling SAAMO™-SR when available. We would expect that a most important perk for contributors is saving young lives, reducing gun injuries and providing families ready defense with SAAMO™-SR.

If crowd funding falls short of target, then the funds will be combined with other funding programs to move the SAAMO_SR program forward as quickly as those funds permit.

- The Impact

The development of the patent pending SAAMO™ line of safety and defense products will be significant. SAAMO™-SR is one of several derivatives that will greatly change the world of guns and offers advantages that can be better described if you visit our website at www.saamotm.com and click the SAAMO™-BT tab. In this, you will find a wealth of new opportunities that are not possible with Smart Gun Technology. Society, of which our contributors are a part, will benefit way beyond what current gun technologies can provide. To be assured of our capabilities to deliver, our company was one of 16 grantees selected out of over 200 applicants worldwide and received grant funds of $50,000 from the Smart Tech Foundation. These funds have and are being applied to the development of SAAMO™-BT.The vetting process was significant and qualifying.

In security access technology, of which firearms fall, please check our main website www.everlokt.com and note our patented Touch-Authentication Technology. This technology provides secure access to facilities and items with just a touch, which is a part of our firearm access plans using SAAMO™.

- Risks & Challenges

The company is in the process of developing the SAAMO™-BT (Bullet) which is much more challenging than SAAMO™-SR (Safety Round). SAAMO™-SR is a derivative of SAAMO™-BT and can begin saving lives much sooner and more cost effectively as a result of being a simpler device.

story:
Service Women's Action Network (SWAN) is a bi-partisan non-profit veterans-led organization that works to transform U.S. Military culture by securing equal opportunity and the freedom to serve in uniform without threat of harassment, discrimination, intimidation or assault.

In 2010, the Department of Defense (DOD) documented 3,158 reports of military sexual assault, but concluded that only 13.5% of total cases were actually reported. DOD estimates that in 2010 alone, over 19,000 sexual assaults occurred in the military. Less than 21% of alleged perpetrators were referred for court-martial; even fewer were convicted or sentenced to prison. 

Truth and Justice: The 2012 Summit on Military Sexual Violence on May 8th, 2012 will give veteran survivors the opportunity to raise their voices and share their experiences directly with legislators so that our policy makers and military leadership can no longer avoid this crisis. It will be the first time in history that survivors of military sexual violence and their families will gather collectively to organize for institutional change. We will convene advocates, military law and policy experts and legislators who are most familiar with military sexual violence for in-depth discussion on the issues facing our movement, and strategies for change. We are dedicated to ensuring that as many veteran survivors as possible are able to attend the Summit by offering a Scholarship Program to applicants.

Your generous support will go directly to our Scholarship Program and help veteran survivors come to Washington, DC to share their experiences and join the groundbreaking movement to end sexual violence in the U.S. Military. Make a donation and it will be matched by a generous donor up to $25,000! Let's help as many veterans as possible get to Washington, DC!    

To learn more about the Summit, please go to www.truthandjusticesummit.org.

story:
Our Mission

*It is our mission to work with those who confront legal challenges and be positive agents for change in the community and the world, at large.

Clear eyes & full hearts:

  • Advocates for Community & Transformative Justice ("ACT Just") stands on the foundation of advocacy -- we are dedicated to the pursuit of making quality representation affordable for ALL.
  • By using a sliding fee scale, we set a price point based on one's individual ability to pay.  
  • Being incorporated as a non-profit allows us to be focused primarily on the mission to serve the community, not counting billable hours like the average law firm, and helps us to offer affordable fees to our clients.

What We Graciously Appreciate & What YOU Get

It's our goal to be in a financial position where we can support you and people like you:

  • With $6,500, we will put the money straight towards modest administrative costs, such as: to secure an office space, printing, even just paper clips --  the very basics. 
  • $1,500 (alone) goes towards applying for tax exempt status through the IRS.
  • Once this is off the ground, you can trust that we will have your back and be even more vibrant members of the community to support your causes.

The Impact & The Ripple Effect

Connection & Community:

  • Our goal is to use our education and gift to serve others while facing challenges, and in turn, those individuals are in the position to use their gifts to serve others.  After all, it is about justice, not just us.

The Truth

We are putting everything on the line to see this firm be a success.  We don't come from particularly privileged backgrounds or trust funds that would allow us to take this extraordinary leap of faith.  We're doing it solely because our hearts are in it -- we fervently believe in the cause and the tremendous potential in being able to help a huge amount of people.

  • Just like you, we have familial responsibilities and bills (not to mention law school debt!) to manage while also trying to build a business from scratch.
  • It is BECAUSE we have experienced financial struggles that we are even more committed to make legal access affordable.
  • With a strong foundation to kick start our success, we KNOW we will be able to put our energies towards helping the community!  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, we COMPLETELY understand, but there are other ways you can help if you believe in our cause:

  •  Make some noise about the campaign! Share with friends & family to spread the word.
  • Like us on Facebook -> ACTJustBoston
  • Remember us!  Keep us in mind for any legal issues you or a friend may confront, small or big. We are here to work with you!

Reach out to us - we love to connect with like-minded people. 

With tremendous gratitude,

Jasmine (Jelatab@act-just.org), and

Rosanna (Rmolinaro@act-just.org)

story:
Short Summary

  • We are a group of 10th grade students who are on a mission to help Hawaiis homeless. 
  • Our campaign has set out to help Hawaiis homeless by granting them with hygiene kits.  This is important to us because because Hawaii ranked second in the United States for unsheltered homeless population.
  • If you contribute to our project your money will go towards buying essential items that Hawaiis homeless need every single day.  

What We Need & What You Get

  • Your money will be going towards buying toiletries such as toothbrushes, shampoo, toothpaste, razors, zip lock bag, deodorant, a bar of bath soap, baby wipes, and diapers. 

The Impact

  • By contributing to this project your funds will help improve hundreds of homeless men, women, children's lives.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to contribute you can help by sharing this project through social media, email, or even just talking about it with your friends.

If you contribute to our project your money will go towards buying essential items that Hawaiis homeless need every single day.  
What We Need & What You GetYour money will be going towards buying toiletries such as toothbrushes, shampoo, toothpaste, razors, zip lock bag, deodorant, a bar of bath soap, baby wipes, and diapers. The ImpactBy contributing to this project your funds will help improve hundreds of homeless men, women, children's lives.  Other Ways You Can HelpIf you are unable to contribute you can help by sharing this project through social media, email, or even just talking about it with your friends.

story:
Short Summary

Welcome is an idea that spawned from a partnership between artist Cal Cullen, executive director of Wave Pool Art Gallery and Sheryl Rajbhandari, founder and executive director of Heartfelt Tidbits.  Both have a passion for art and humanitarian work associated with immigrants and refugees.  Welcome Home, Café and Boutique was a natural fit to provide solutions to gaps they had identified within the local community of the immigrants and refugees. 

While the city has 80+ providers that do a tremendous job in assisting with welcoming refugees we recognize the need to expand this.  Many who are marginalized and at risk feel isolated and vulnerable.  Their art enables them to share their voice without the language and build friendships through the program.  Our goal is that this through this business we will be empower immigrants and refugees with knowledge and break down the barriers that many face related to employment and housing.

“The women in our weekly art classes are learning much more than just art skills, they are learning language, making friends, and building community.”

— SHERYL RAJBHANDARI, FOUNDER

What We Need & What You Get

In late April we were able to open the store with a tremendous amount of community support and donated elbow grease. In order to open the cafe and merge the two storefronts however, we need some financial backing. 

We're trying to get $10,000 which will allow us to hire a store manager, get architectural plans drawn and submitted to rehab the space, work on making the space ADA compliant, pay rent, and purchase some needed restaurant equipment.

As a thank you for your contribution we have some amazing perks available, including art made by the ladies who will be running the business, Welcome stationary, and hand made goods. 

The Impact

The Impact of the Store:

Over the past 9 months local immigrant and refugee women have been meeting at the Wave Pool and Reading Lockland Presbyterian Church for art and sewing classes.  Through these programs artists and skillsets have emerged.  As visitors and guest instructors have visited many asked if they could purchase items that were being locally made.  The boutique provides this opportunity.

The storefront is not just a retail store. It is a community living room and a workshop space. It is a place for our newest neighbors to teach their skills to the public and to share what they have made. It is a place for neighborhood kids to stop in and make art at any time. It is a place for sewing, sharing, and making friends. 

The Impact of the Cafe: 

In addition to being a full functioning restaurant in Camp Washington, the café will serve three other purposes, culinary employment training, and an incubator site for refugees who seek to someday open their own restaurant and ability for local immigrant and refugee gardeners to sell fresh produce.  A pastry chef will be employed to train students over a eight week period all aspects of operating a café, including:
·      Menu planning
·      Food supplies and inventory
·      Food safety
·      Food preparation and pastry skills

Upon completion of the training programs, participants will then receive assistance with obtaining food service employment.

Camp Washington has been identified as a food dessert in Cincinnati.  Through a partnership with Heartfelt Tidbits and Turner Farms an idea was created that local immigrant gardeners could leverage the café as a place to sell their local produce.  The produce purchased would be used for the café and also be available for purchase by the local community.  

The Impact of the Housing:

The “Welcome Housing Project” at 2936 Colerain Ave. consists of 8 one-bedroom apartments.  They are all currently occupied and all in relatively rough condition. As apartments are vacated, the plan is to
·      Renovate them with newer appliances,
·      Refinish plumbing, and
·      Update heating and air conditioning units

 We envision one or two of the apartments to be allocated for transitional housing.  The other apartments will be rented to refugees and immigrants, identified through our collaborative partners. We will work closely with our partner organizations to find the right tenants for this building. The plan is that these apartments would be part of a rental equity program, where tenants who pay rent on time and take care of their apartment will earn credits that can be redeemed toward the purchase of a home when they are ready to move.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate to this campaign, there are other ways to help! If you live nearby and would like to help, we accept volunteers regardless of skill level. We specifically need help cleaning, rehabbing the storefronts and apartments, and assisting us with setting up the restaurant and getting it code compliant. Donations are vital to the feasibility of this project. We are specifically looking for kitchen and dining items, retail shelving and hardware, as well as commercial kitchen fixtures. We have compiled a wishlist of these items which you can view here. 

Thank you for your support!

If you can't donate to this campaign, there are other ways to help! If you live nearby and would like to help, we accept volunteers regardless of skill level. We specifically need help cleaning, rehabbing the storefronts and apartments, and assisting us with setting up the restaurant and getting it code compliant. Donations are vital to the feasibility of this project. We are specifically looking for kitchen and dining items, retail shelving and hardware, as well as commercial kitchen fixtures. We have compiled a wishlist of these items which you can view here. 
Thank you for your support!

story:
MASQUE STUDIOS UTAH


                                                                                         

INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN

LAUNCH

09.28.12

 

“Pathway of Honor”                               

Phase 1


Masque Studios Utah is proud to present a project that is near and dear to our heart...
September 28, 2012  we will launch our campaign "Pathway of Honor"  and begin designs and ultimately construction on the worlds first ever stone pathway dedicated to the men and women of the US Armed Forces.  Our goal is to engrave the path starting with all names of those who have served  since the Gulf War to the present. Masque Studios Utah wants to build this pathway as an ever lasting statement of gratitude and honor to all servicemen and women of the United States.

The origin of this idea came about during a Masque strategy meeting concerning design and construction of our “World Class Motion Picture & Digital Media Studio”.  Masque Studios Utah is  currently being developed within a 400 acre Alpine site in Park City Utah.  We currently have several working relationships with various organizations that support the efforts of U.S. Armed Services personnel, both retired and currently serving.  Masque will become affiliated with the programs of the “Wounded Warriors Project” Veterans Administration, National Ability Center and  many more organizations not yet identified as of this writing. Our first goal of building a new studio, is to teach and train for entertainment related and digital media positions which we have calculated to be no less than 2000 new high paying jobs over the next five years. In addition, our first adopted hiring protocol is to give first priority to returning vets.  But its not enough.. we want to do more! So, while recently filming a promo documentary in Park City Utah for another US Military project... “Before You Were Born” our documentary team came up with the idea how we at Masque Studios could continue showing our support “for as long as it takes”  giving all Americans a place to see the engraved names of their loved ones in a meandering pathway of stone pavers.  Each paver individually engraved with that person’s name, rank, armed services affiliation and date of service, laid end to end in a beautiful, architecturally brilliant setting for the public to see, enjoy, and hopefully marvel at its existence.


Our Mission:
To construct a winding pathway five feet wide and for as long as it takes to accommodate various phases starting with 1.5 million engraved brick pavers  with each and every person who has served in the Armed Services, starting with the Gulf Wars (1990) through to the present. This pathway will be constructed and maintained in perpetuity by Masque Studios Utah.

Your Mission:
Is to spread the word, help us build this everlasting “Pathway of Honor” laid in a stone trail, supporting the Armed Forces of America.  A small way to honor not only those who have given the greatest sacrifice, but also to those who have served, in some cases (many tours) whether in active combat or any other supportive environment throughout their military career... they still served and we at Masque want to recognize them for their service of which many of them, maybe most... who started by giving up their remaining teenage years to serve their country.

We recognize that this is a massive undertaking and it could take years (less than five) to complete. Respectively, we couldn’t begin to realize this dream without the greater American community supporting our our efforts to construct this everlasting pathway. Your donation in support of only one military individual either a family soldier, extended family or friend. If the word of this campaignspreads quickly through social media, if each and every family supports just one loved one....  than Masque Studios Utah will live up to its motto ….“Nothing to it but to do it!!”      

Thank you so much for this opportunity to make a difference in every “soldier’s life”

The Masque Studios Team
Park City, Utah
www.masquestudiosutah.com
www.masquestudiosutah@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

I'm a social worker of 10 years, first beginning on the West Side of Chicago where I worked with a team of volunteers to manage a 250 bed men and women's shelter.  From those beginnings, I went on to a career as a case manager/outreach worker, first working on the CTA project, a city of Chicago funded project that provided outreach and case management to individuals using public transportation as housing, and then working as the only paid social worker for a small agency targeting the homeless and homeless families on the Northwest side of Chicago.  In my experiences as a social worker, I have been able to effectively provide comprehensive outreach and follow up care, to help individuals apply for resources they otherwise might not know they're eligible for, and to assist clients into temporary and then permanent housing.  I see a great need for this kind of targeted outreach in and around the Durham downtown area where in the middle of the day, you can find many people in need either parked on a bench or spending their time waiting for an overnight shelter to open.  I have the skills and an understanding of the services offered here in Durham, to be able to reach out to such individuals and assist them in their needs, whether it's a bus card to be able to make a medical appointment, food to eat or just a connection to agencies in the area.  In a more intangible sense, I have an ability to empathize and connect with folks who might not talk to another social worker because I'm willing and able to meet the client where they're at and provide concrete outcomes that can help change their lives.

What We Need & What You Get

What I need to be able to begin a project of this nature is 15,000 dollars, a sum of money that will be spent on bus cards, temporary housing, rental assistance for individuals who are in danger of losing their housing, and food assistance including food gift cards.  What you would receive as a funder is entirely up to you.  I would be more than happy to invite any funders out to do outreach with me, to get your boots on the ground and assist in having an impact above and beyond your donation.  Financially, we would remain transparent as every dollar spent on program related expenses vs. actual client expenditures would be well documented.  Notes on all clients interacted with and the nature of those interactions would be documented as well with client's names redacted in order to comply with confidentiality rules.

    The Impact

    The impact of a project of this nature cannot be understated.  It has been my experience that with a small amount of resources and a great level of respect and resourcefulness for clients, we can accomplish a lot.  We may not end homelessness in the Durham area but by targeting the areas in which the homeless spend their time and offering them alternatives to the services they're used to receiving, we may be able to make a huge impact in their lives.

      Risks & Challenges

      The risks of a project like this as with any in social work is that clients won't be willing to accept help but one of the ways we can overcome that is by using our greatest asset, namely, my ability to connect with clients using 10 years of experience in the outreach and case management and my ability to empathize with an individual who may be used to being marginalized, even by other social workers they've come into contact with.  The challenges are the same; A large percentage of the people I come into contact with, whether through mental illness or drug abuse may be unwilling or unable to accept help but it is the percentage that we are able to help that will provide us with the incentive we need to move this project forward and perhaps help in some small way to change the landscape of downtown Durham.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you can't contribute, that's fine, perhaps some nights or days as we do targeted outreach, we will need volunteers to help make meals to bring out on outreach or simply, someone to come along and offer their own counterpoint to my own style of outreach.  Sometimes, clients respond well to one outreach worker and sometimes they respond to a dyad but either way, you can help get the word out that there are resources available and hopefully I can be one of those valuable resources.

story:
Qui sommes-nous?

Le Comité pour les droits humains en Amérique latine (CDHAL) est une organisation de solidarité fondée en 1976 qui travaille à la défense et à la promotion des droits humains en réciprocité avec les mouvements sociaux et les communautés d’Amérique latine dans la lutte en faveur de la justice sociale, environnementale et culturelle.

À l’heure actuelle, la conjoncture sociopolitique en Amérique latine nous donne l’impression de replonger dans l’époque sombre des dictatures militaires et des conflits armés des années 1970-1980 en Amérique latine. Dans ce contexte, le travail du CDHAL s’avère pertinent afin de documenter et diffuser les violations des droits à la vie, à un environnement sain, à l’autodétermination, à l’intégrité, à la sécurité et à la liberté commises par les États en complicité avec de grandes entreprises transnationales, dont certaines sont canadiennes.

Notre mission permet d’amplifier les voix des mouvements sociaux et des organisations populaires en résistance face à l’extractivisme, la racine des violences et de la migration forcée de millions de personnes provenant des Amériques et de partout ailleurs. 

 

Que faisons-nous concrètement?

Le CDHAL, à travers son équipe des actions urgentes, entretient des liens de réciprocité avec les mouvements sociaux et les groupes de base en Amérique latine, notamment au Mexique, au Guatemala, au Honduras, en Colombie, en Équateur, au Brésil et au Chili. Nous sommes particulièrement interpellées par la situation de défenseur-e-s des droits humains, qui compromettent leur sécurité et leur vie en utilisant leurs corps comme boucliers pour préserver leurs territoires, l‘environnement, leurs lieux de travail et de vie, ainsi que la Terre-Mère.

C’est à travers le programme des actions urgentes que nous effectuons un suivi de l’actualité d’Amérique latine et la diffusons au Québec et au Canada, recevons des demandes d’appuis des communautés et des mouvements sociaux, participons à de nombreuses campagnes, et rédigeons et traduisons des communiqués, déclarations et pétitions ayant pour objectif de faire pression pour des cas particuliers et de contribuer à l’éducation du public.

L’équipe des actions urgentes, coordonnée par une responsable et composée de stagiaires de différents programmes universitaires et de militant.e.s, est mobilisée toute l’année afin de produire et diffuser des nouvelles en espagnol et en français pour rendre ces informations accessibles pour le public québécois, canadien et latino-américain à travers le bulletin mensuel Solidared : voix de résistances dans les Amériques (en version écrite et audio) et aussi via notre site Internet, notre page Facebook et notre compte Soundcloud.

L’information partagée à travers ce bulletin provient de différents mouvements, organisations sociales et groupes de base qui travaillent pour la justice sociale et environnementale à travers le continent. Elle constitue donc des nouvelles de première source qui ne sont pas diffusées par les médias traditionnels.

Nous nous impliquons aussi dans les initiatives de plaidoyer et d'éducation au Québec et au Canada, en co-organisant avec des organisations partenaires des actions pour rendre visibles les luttes entamées en Amérique latine. 

À titre d’exemple, le CDHAL a mobilisé cette année des dizaines d’organisations de la société civile canadienne pour mettre en oeuvre une tournée pancanadienne "Justice énergétique: pour la défense du fleuve Cauca" d’une représentante du Mouvement Rios Vivos Colombia, qui depuis une décennie s’oppose à l’installation du mégaprojet hydroélectrique Hidroituango, financé entre autres par la Caisse de dépôt et placement du Québec et par Exportation et développement Canada. 

De plus, face à la récente situation d’urgence et de violence au Chili, une membre de notre équipe participe à la Mission d’observation internationale convoquée par la Coordination des organisations de droits humains de l’Araucanie afin de documenter et de diffuser les agissements de l’État chilien en ce moment. 

Le bouleversement sociopolitique au Brésil avec l’arrivée au pouvoir de Bolsonaro a également interpellé le CDHAL qui a appuyé diverses actions avec le Coletivo Brasil-Montreal, dont le colloque international “Où va le Brésil?” et le concert bénéfice pour l’Amazonie qui est venu en appui à une association de femmes autochtones touchées par les incendies qui menacent encore la forêt et ses peuples.

 

Pourquoi soutenir cette campagne?

Votre appui nous permettra de poursuivre notre travail quotidien de veille et de diffusion des violations des droits humains et des actions de résistance à travers les Amériques et de répondre aux différents appels de solidarité. Les raisons sont nombreuses pour continuer à lutter et à dénoncer puisque, à chaque jour, des peuples des Amériques résistent devant un modèle qui privilégie les intérêts privés et transnationaux au détriment des communautés locales et où la criminalisation des défenseur.e.s des droits humains, du territoire et de l’eau ne fait que s’intensifier avec les gouvernements d’extrême-droite.

 

Contreparties

Dans le cadre de cette campagne de financement, vous pourrez vous procurez, en contrepartie d'un don, un billet pour participer à notre soirée festive, qui aura lieu le 6 décembre prochain, à Montréal. Ce sera l’occasion de lancer le premier numéro de la prochaine édition de notre revue Caminando qui portera sur les causes profondes des migrations et qui comportera 2 numéros dont le suivant est prévu en mai 2020. Un don au CDHAL pourrait ainsi vous permettre d'obtenir en contrepartie une copie de la revue ou de vous abonner pour obtenir les 2 numéros!

 

Dons de bienfaisance

Aussi, pour les dons de 20$ et plus,  nous vous émettrons un reçu de charité pour fins d'impôts pour l'année 2019 qui vous sera envoyé en février 2020. Veuillez nous envoyer votre adresse postale à coordo@cdhal.org 

 

Merci à l'avance pour votre générosité! Tous les dons, même les plus petits, font une réelle différence pour notre équipe et notre travail de solidarité avec les mouvements sociaux en Amérique latine.

 

Aidez-nous à diffuser largement la campagne dans vos réseaux!

story:
Guten Tag werte Damen und Herren,

es erfüllt mich mit Freude Sie hier begrüßen zu dürfen.
Wie Sie wohl bereits aus der Überschrift erschließen konnten, geht es um ein Projekt, das eine erhebliche Steigerung der Lebensqualität für einen unserer Mitbürger zur Folge haben könnte, sofern es erfolgreich ist.
Die Situation ist folgende: Ein junger Mann, welcher mir über die Kurznachrichten-Plattform Twitter bekannt geworden ist, muss im Moment ohne Met auskommen. Daher habe ich mir gedacht, um dem jungen Mann jederzeit Zugang zu dem köstlichen Getränk zu verschaffen, werde ich ihm einen Vorrat kaufen. Leider sind nun meine bescheidenen Mittel nicht genug um ein derartiges Projekt zu stämmen.
Und hier kommt Ihr ins Spiel:
Jeder, der ein wenig beiträgt unterstützt das große Ganze. Wenn das Ziel erreicht ist werde ich bei einem renomierten Online-Handel die Bestellung von ca. 62 Flaschen Met aufgeben, welche direkt an den Begünstigten geliefert werden.
Jeder, der mehr als 50 € gibt, bekommt selbst eine Flasche des goldenen Safts zugeschickt, mit einer öffentlichen Danksagung auf Twitter.

Sollte wieder erwarten nur ein Teilbetrag zustande kommen, wird der Wert von mir auf die nächsten 50 € aufgerundet und der dafür erhältliche Met besorgt.

 Die Situation ist folgende: Ein junger Mann, welcher mir über die Kurznachrichten-Plattform Twitter bekannt geworden ist, muss im Moment ohne Met auskommen. Daher habe ich mir gedacht, um dem jungen Mann jederzeit Zugang zu dem köstlichen Getränk zu verschaffen, werde ich ihm einen Vorrat kaufen. Leider sind nun meine bescheidenen Mittel nicht genug um ein derartiges Projekt zu stämmen. Und hier kommt Ihr ins Spiel: Jeder, der ein wenig beiträgt unterstützt das große Ganze. Wenn das Ziel erreicht ist werde ich bei einem renomierten Online-Handel die Bestellung von ca. 62 Flaschen Met aufgeben, welche direkt an den Begünstigten geliefert werden.
Jeder, der mehr als 50 € gibt, bekommt selbst eine Flasche des goldenen Safts zugeschickt, mit einer öffentlichen Danksagung auf Twitter.Sollte wieder erwarten nur ein Teilbetrag zustande kommen, wird der Wert von mir auf die nächsten 50 € aufgerundet und der dafür erhältliche Met besorgt.

story:
Pre-Order in Time for 

Breast Cancer Awareness Month!

The mission of The Tutu Project™ is to support the fund raising efforts of The Carey Foundation, our non-profit for men and women with breast cancer. We strive to bring laughter and understanding to a community that has endured far too much.  Funds raised with the support of The Tutu Project, individual and corporate donations are provided directly to organizations that offer assistance with cancer-related costs like transportation to treatment, home care, childcare and medical supplies.

Don't know us? Watch our amazing video courtesy of Deutsche Telekom.

Last year, we published a calendar through a 3rd party publisher and the calendar sold out (insert sad face).  For the 2015 calendar, we would like maintain control over inventory in order to meet our amazing fan's demand.  Help us do that by pre-ordering your calendar and buying some additional perks!

What We Need & What You Get

We hope you will help us finance this project.  Our goal is to raise $30,000 by August 21 to help cover expenses for the production of The Tutu Project 2015 Calendar.

What costs are we trying to cover?

Costs include design, printing, paper, shipping, and fulfillment resources - just to name a few.  

The Goods

Okay, here is how cool the calendar looks (Proposed cover; not final):


    What Happens if We Don't Raise the Funds?

    If for some reason we do not raise the funds, our supporters will be refunded through Indiegogo AND WE WILL NOT PRINT A CALENDAR (insert double sad face here).  But since we have the best fans in the world, we have NO DOUBT that together, we can make this happen! 

    We Can Read Your Mind. Are You Wondering...

    Why is the calendar more in 2015 than 2014? 

    The 2015 calendar will retail for $19.99.  The price to pre-order includes shipping and handling.  In 2014, we used a publisher, whose buying power and resources are much greater than ours.  In order to get this product to market, we have to ensure we cover costs and have enough left (net proceeds) to donate to the Carey Foundation.

    How much is being donated to the Foundation?

    This is not a fund raiser for our non-profit.  We are trying to raise the funds to cover the cost of the project.  However, once costs are covered, a percent of sales will be donated to the Carey Foundation.  We won’t have a final percent until after we understand how much we raise to cover costs.  Our goal is to donate between 5 - 10% of net proceeds to the Foundation from overall calendar sales.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know not everyone can contribute money to this campaign. We completely understand that. That being said, there are a few other ways you can help us out:

    • Spread the word far and wide. Tell friends and neighbors. Post/Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Pinterest. Wear a tutu! Dedicate a picture to us! 
    • Read up on the Carey Foundation. It's a great cause, and if it helps inspire you to save up to donate, we'll love you for that too.
    • Do a random act of kindness in a tutu... laughter goes a long way for anyone on any given day.
    Corporate Sponsorships

      If you are interested in becoming a corporate sponsor and having your company's information in the 2015 calendar, please contact us directly at hello (at) thetutuproject.com.
