story:
Introduction:

This campaign calls for the recognition of the human RIGHT TO KNOW by the United Nations. It is crucial to know how and why governments make decisions that affect human rights and freedoms. Governments have to be held accountable and they should provide information accurately and thoroughly without any prior request by the citizenry. Although Freedom of Information Acts (FOIAs) provide citizens with the right to access to certain types of information, their application is overall patchy and inadequate.

 

 

Fifty years after the end of World War II, the ‘90s sparked fervent hope in the worldwide affirmation of human rights and democracy for all. At the turn of the millennium, such hopes rapidly vanished the ideals of a universal application of human rights and a democratic rule of law have crushed in most if not all established democracies.

We believe it is not too late to turn the table around. A stern return to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the democratic Rule of Law can avoid the looming disaster ahead of us. And we need your help.

The results of our analysis, based on a decade of research and political action, confirms the thesis formulated by Professor Deirdre Curtin in her critique of the democratic deficit in the European Union. Public debate in democratic societies is increasingly reduced to a consideration of today’s “emergency” issues. In an era of unlimited communication possibilities, little to no room is left for profound studies and debates on causes and long-term effects. Instead, modern media theorems dictate a regime where public opinion is fed a constant flow of pro and contra propositions on the extremes of both sides of the debate. Distracted by the noise of these emergencies, information on other decisions being taken are kept away from the public eye and from the parliamentary floor as well. When today’s citizens in a democratic society are not fully enjoying their democratic rights by participating in public debate, the rights of others around the world are at stake.

Over the last two decades, the world has witnessed an increase in terrorist attacks and augmented and use of military capabilities in the name of national security, against the threats from terrorism, immigration, drugs. Victims of the multifaceted Reason of State are human rights, democratic accountability, lack of monitoring in the decision-making process, and peace. The RULE OF LAW is increasingly replaced by the Rule of Law Enforcement.

We propose an antidote that seeks to complete, as was the original function in 1948, the human rights framework of freedom of expression and the right to seek and impart information in a democratic society: the recognition of the human RIGHT TO KNOW by the United Nations. It is crucial to know how and why governments make decisions that affect human rights and freedoms. A properly enforced right to know would improve the relationship between elected officials and voters and foster the development of the democratic rule of law. Governments have to be held accountable and they should provide information accurately and thoroughly without any prior request by the citizenry.

It is YOUR human right to know.

 

What we have done so far:

- Published two books "Reason of State vs Rule of Law" and "SOS Rule of Law";

- Created the "Global Committee for the Rule of Law", which is lobbying MPs and governemnt officials to support our proposal; 

- Produced the study "Unlocking the right to know" on the existing literature on the Right to Know so far;


 

- Held a First International Conference in Brussels at the European Parliament and European Commission, 18-19 February 2014 available here;

- Convened public meetings at: 
   - UN Human Rights Council, Geneva, 18 Sep 2014, watch here;
   - House of Commons, London, 22 Oct 2014, listen here;
   - Chamber of Deputies, Rome, 4 Dec 2014, watch here;
   - Institute of Philosophical Studies, Naples, 19 January 2015, watch here;
   - Senate of France, Paris, 30 March 2015, watch here;

- Held a Second  International Conference at the Senate of the Republic, Rome, "Universality of human rights for the transition towards the Rule of Law and the affirmation of the Right to Know", 27 July 2015, watch here;

- Held an International round-table at the UN Human Rights Council, Geneva, 13 May 2016, with Permanent Representatives of: Italy, Ireland, Morocco, Mexico, Canada. Watch here;

- Held an international technical seminar at the Senate of the Republic, Rome, 29 November 2016, watch here; 

 

 

With your help we can:

· MEET Member States Representatives at the United Nations Human Rights Council in Geneva and at the United Nations in New York;

· RUN a public awareness campaign, through meetings, seminaries, articles, radio programmes;

· SPREAD the appeal for the Right to Know;

· ORGANIZE follow-up activities to be undertaken at the UN, including meetings with officials and NGOs representatives, side-events, press conferences;

· FEED our online platform www.globalcommitteefortheruleoflaw.org

The right to know is a tenet of the rule of law, that is why we propose a formal, universal recognition of the human and civil “Right to Know” how and why governments make decisions at different levels. We do not want to abolish State Secrecy, but limit its use and abuse by revising and enhancing existing mechanisms of democratic oversight to enable the advancement of a democratic, national and international Rule of Law. We need to gather more support from citizens, and experts in the fields of human rights and international law. 

We have come a long way.

We can't stop now.

PLEASE DONATE

 

Our team:

Nonviolent Radical Party Transnational and Transparty (NRPTT) is a political organisation – with General Consultative Status at the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) – promoting the application and respect of Human Rights and the Rule of Law. The NRPTT has participated in the work of various UN bodies on matters related to the promotion of civil and political rights; the support of bilateral and multilateral actions for the promotion of democracy in the world; the support of the activities of the ad hoc Tribunals for the Former Yugoslavia and for Rwanda; the establishment of the International Criminal Court; the adoption of the resolution for a moratorium on capital executions by the UN General Assembly; the promotion of an international ban on female genital mutilations.

Global Committee for the Rule of Law - Marco Pannella (GCRL) is a no-profit organization founded by the late Marco Pannella, leader of NRPTT. It is tasked specifically with promoting the rule of law through the initiative for the recognition of the right to know at the United Nations. 

Hands Off Cain (HOC) is a no-profit organization founded in 1994 advocating the gradual abolition of the death penalty worldwide through the promotion of a UN moratorium on capital executions.

Summary

  • For the 2nd year in a row we are raising funds to sponsor/subsidize summer camp for Refugee and Foster Children in Ukraine.
  • There's never been a more important time for what Ruka Dopomogy does in Ukraine. Because of the ongoing war with Russia in eastern Ukraine young people are searching for hope for their future.  Since January 2014 the Ukrainian currency (Hryvnia) has dropped dramatically against the US Dollar (from 8:1 to more than 30:1 at one point) yet income has not increased at all! As a result, summer camp, especially for vulnerable children such as those displaced by the war in the east, is a financial impossibility!
  • Igor Minenko is President of Ruka Dopomogy, an 18 year old Ukrainian Charity Fund (non-profit). RD has trained hundreds of youth workers in churches all over Ukraine how to build Jesus Focused Youth Ministries.  Before leading RD, he was the youth pastor at one of the largest youth ministries in Kiev.  Under his leadership Ruka Dopomogy has sponsored Summer Youth & Children Camps in western Ukraine since 2010. He also serves as the Director of Youth Alpha Course in Ukraine.

What We Need

  •  One week of Summer Camp will cost $31.50 USD. We want to provide a 50% subsidy for Foster Children and a 75% subsidy for Refugee Children and we are planning for 50 of each during our three weeks of summer camps.  Two years ago a week of summer camp cost approximately 200 Hryvnia  (about $25 USD at the time).  Not expensive, right? Today, that same $25.00 USD = about 600 UAH, and remember, Ukrainian wages have NOT increased. The kids and families we work with, especially displaced children and their families cannot afford a three or four fold increase. For the amount of money your teenager will spend on snacks and fast food on the way to camp, you can sponsor a Ukrainian Child or Teenager for a week of camp. 
  • Our camp is small but awesome! Our capacity is only about 60 kids per week and because of time limitations at our venue we can only host 3 camps. Expenses are low because facilities are shockingly sparse and Staff pay their own way. There are no salaries! 85% of your donation (85% of $37.00 = $31.50) will sponsor a week of camp for a child or teenager. 15% will be shared with International Teams-US, our parent ministry/US 501c3 based in Elgin, Illinois and cover the cost of using Indigogo and/or Paypal.
  • Our goal of $2500 will subsidize camp cost for 50 refugee children and 50 foster children. Last summer more than half of the kids in our three camps were refugee and foster children.  If we raise more than our goal then International Teams and Ruka Dopomogy will help fund additional ministries with refugee and at-risk children.

The Impact

  • Many of the kids we're ministering with are facing an uncertain future. Many of them have fled their homes in war torn eastern Ukraine and may not ever return. They are stressed and their parents are stressed. You contribution will give them a week of respite in the foothills of the Carpathian Mountains. They'll sleep in tents, they'll hike the mountains, swim the river, and sing around campfires. They'll practice English, they'll play games and participate in competitions. They'll hear the Gospel every day and they'll be loved and cared for by veteran youth workers from among the churches Ruka Dopomogy has trained.
  • 2016 is the sixth year of our camping ministry. Up until two summers ago we were seeing a lot of "repeat" kids from the churches we've coached. Beginning last summer we started receiving children and teens who were displaced by the war; the need is even greater this summer.

Camp Staff

  • Our camps are staffed with full-time workers from International Teams and Ruka Dopomogy Staff along with volunteers from local and participating churches. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word for us through email and all forms of social media.
  • Pray for us.
  • You can donate through Indiegogo to our US parent organization, International Teams. You can also give via Paypal directly to Igor Minenko's account (http://www.paypal.com to "iminenko@ukr.net").

story:
Mission: To raise $4,500 to free and help 50 slaves in Latin America, by spreading awareness and encouraging for donations.

Facts:

  • Slavery still exists today.
  • Around 1.3 million people can be considered slaves in Latin America and The Caribbean. (Angenda Sur America)
  • Haiti: 237,700 enslaved; Brazil: 155,300 enslave (Free the Slaves)
  • Perú is the country with the second-highest amount of slaves in all of Latin America. Haiti is home to the highest number of slaves in the region.  (Walk Free Foundation)
  • According to the government, more than 20,000 Mexican children are victims of sex trafficking every year, especially in tourist and border areas. ( U.S. State Dept Trafficking in Persons Report, June 2009)
  • The average cost of a modern day slave is a mere $90. (Free the Slaves)
  • YOU can do something about it.
Donations:
All the money will be donated to Free the Slaves to rescue, free, and help slaves in Latin America. Today, the average price of a slave is $90. As free people, we can at least save 50 enslaved people in Latin America. Not only that, but also ensure they have a normal, sustainable life. Please, use your freedom to free slaves!

Spread Awareness with Art:

story:
We Need Help to Survive


Hi,

We are the Maetreum of Cybele in the tiny hamlet of Palenville, NY.    We are an incorporated church and religious charity that is fully IRS 501(c)(3) registered and own our property deeded to the incorporated church.  As a convent of women dedicated to the Great Mother Goddess we do our charitable works on a fully volunteer basis, none of us are paid anything.

Over the past ten or so years we have housed and fed more than 35 women in need and helped them restart their lives, donated food, clothes and furniture to others in need, raised and disbursed funds to help victims of hurricane Katrina and served as a refuge for our community when it was hard hit by hurricane Irene.  We want to set up a local food bank and have a construction permit from the FCC to start a low powered FM community radio station.

We need help because despite all we do for our local community, a few religious bigots on the board of the Town of Catskill New York want us gone.  For eight long years now they have fought our legally mandated property tax exemption forcing us to court to fight for legal parity with every other church in our community.  A community that routinely grants full exemption to Catholic picnic grounds but not us.   Our story has been covered in Pagan circles for years as well as our local press and even by the New York Times.  We lost our initial court case, appealed to Appellate level where we won an unanimous four judge decision 

We did not figure on the level of hatred the Town of Catskill held towards us.  In a unique move and at huge taxpayer expense, Catskill appealed our win to the New York Court of Appeals, the highest court in New York.  At a time we have been left broke by huge winter bills and prior legal fees we must now raise 15 thousand dollars just to maintain our win.  We need help so we can just return to doing our charitable works.  Your donation will help us survive.

We have raised the first 3 thousand ourselves but we have to hit a goal of 10 thousand to stay in the fight.   We have some perks for those that help including a beautifully framed limited edition  picture from all four Alien movies signed by Sigourney Weaver for the first donation over 2 thousand dollars, copies of our book, The Cybeline Revival for donations 100 dollars or more and bumper stickers for donations of 25 dollars or more that say Catskill = Religious Bigotry, I support the Maetreum of Cybele.  All the collected funds will go towards our legal fees and less the value of received perks, fully tax deductible.

This is an important legal issue for all minority religious groups not only in New York, but the entire country.  If they can do it to us, who dotted all the legal "i"s and crossed all the legal "t"s, it can be done to any minority church from any tradition.

If you cannot make a donation at this time, you can sign up with Amazon smiles and list us as your charity at smile.amazon.com and a part of all your purchases will be donated to us directly at no additional cost to you.

Thank you

story:
a little about project outpour

we exist to fight a simple yet significant issue in charlotte – the lack of access to showers and toilets for men and women who are moving through homelessness by putting a mobile shower unit on our streets. why? it’s simple. dignity matters and is a very real desire of every single person, regardless of circumstance.

think about how good you feel after a shower. we bet you feel recharged, refreshed, confident and ready to tackle the day. regardless of circumstance, every person deserves to feel uplifted.

we will literally set up shop on the streets. our customized shower trailer is 20 feet long and comes complete with two private bathrooms – one of which that’s slightly larger to accommodate families and persons with disabilities. each bathroom has its own sink, mirror, toilet and shower. guests are given 15 minutes, and we provide them with any supplies they may need. 

 

what we need & where your donation goes

we sent our down payment to a speciality trailer company in chicago so our mobile shower unit is being built right this minute. we are raising $20,000 and here's where that money will go:

  • the remaining balance for the trailer.
  • comprehensive insurance for the truck and trailer.
  • supplies - we will be supplying all the usual shower suspects (shampoo, conditioner, soap, towels, etc.) but things like nail clippers, underwear, feminine products, etc, are needed too.

when we exceed our campaign goal (not if but when, right?!), that money will help support operational expenses (fuel, staff to drive the truck and set up shop, security, permits, etc). we're hoping to have a truck donated (that will pull that trailer) but if not, funding from this campaign will help us purchase a gently used pickup.

the impact

according to mecklenburg county’s point in time count report, 1,668 people identified themselves as homeless in mecklenburg county in 2018 (up 13% from 2017). we will be able to meet them, literally, where they are, with our mobile shower trailer.

many of the men and women we know who are homeless will tell you that a shower is the difference between setting up an interview or not; is the difference between landing that job; is the difference between keeping that job. we feel opportunities present themselves when people are treated with dignity. we feel something as basic as a shower can be a catalyst for change in the lives of those we serve.

risks & challenges

believe it or not, the biggest challenge is water disposal. we won't bore you with the details of black water and gray water but trust us, you don't want those dumped just anywhere. we are working with charlotte water to work through all of those details. 

we've also had to overcome naysayers or people who don't think a shower is a big deal. our response to that - dignity is a basic human right, and so is regular access to clean water to maintain one's hygiene. some of the push back has come from people concerned a shower isn't "enough." we will serve as a safe place for men and women moving through homelessness and  we will serve as connectors. that's what makes our model so cool - while our guests are waiting to shower, we have the opportunity to engage them in authentic connection to discern their greater needs. through those connections, we'll be able to direct them to resources in the city to get them on a greater path of self-sufficiency and ultimately, housing.

other ways you can help

while we hope you'll donate to our cause (even $1 makes a difference), there are other ways you can get involved:

  • follow us on facebook and instagram (@projectoutpourclt).
  • email hello@projectoutpour.org with any questions, ideas, or non-monetary donations. you can check out our website for a complete list of on-going items we'll need.
  • share this campaign with your community of family, friends, colleagues and strangers (hey, strangers share in our space with us, right?!)

and that's all there is to it! thank you for supporting our mission.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
In 2013 I was invited by a loving group called From Here To Haiti, to join their mission to help rebuild schools and churches in Haiti. 

My trip will take place from February 14th - February 22nd, 2014.

Airfare and travel expenses are the only thing holding me back from making a difference.

While in Haiti, not only will I restore buildings in the community, but I will be an inspiring peer leader to young men and women. 

My team at Windows of Opportunity Inc. and I will take our passion with us and put our Love in Action.

story:
Honor Flight flies World War II veterans to their Memorial at no cost to them.   Time is running for these heroes.   With over 800 World War II veterans dying each day this is our last chance as a Nation to say "Thank you".   Honor Flight Networks has flown over 118,000 veterans to their Memorial in the last eight years.  The North Country Honor Flight flew five flights in 2013 with 80 WW-II vets aboard,  and for 2014 we have seven flights scheduled and over 160 veterans to fly.   This is a very expensive proposition,  we charter entire jet aircraft for each flight to give the veterans their 'flight of a lifetime.'

 

As the founder and Director of the North Country Honor Flight I have had the unique privilege of meeting hundreds of our Nation's greatest heroes.   Nothing we could ever do could repay them for their sacrifices,  in the words of President Harry S. Truman: "OUR DEBT TO THE HEROIC MEN AND VALIANT WOMEN IN THE SERVICE  OF OUR COUNTRY CAN NEVER BE REPAID. THEY HAVE EARNED OUR UNDYING GRATITUDE. AMERICA WILL NEVER FORGET THEIR SACRIFICES " which is inscribed in granite on the wall of the National World War II Memorial in Washington DC which we visit.

What We Need & What You Get

 

The $3500 campaign we are promoting here will pay for seven more WW-II veterans' experiencing their own Honor Flight.   Please help in any way you can, the reward you will receive is immeasurable.

The Impact

Many of these heroes we fly,  upon returning at the end of their Honor Flight describe this as one of the greatest days of their lives.   One WW-II veteran who fought at the Battle of the Bulge in 1945 stated "This day awakened the true meaning of my life"

Other Ways You Can Help

Please support all of the Honor Flight missions across the country or in your own state,  and whenever you meet a Veteran, please thank them for their service.

story:
Who Are We?

We are an open and diverse network of Armed Forces veterans who support Independence for Scotland and will work with others to achieve this aim.

We are a broad-based campaigning group who plan to LISTEN to Scotland's veterans. We aim to ensure veterans are involved in the democratic process, in the independence debate.

We will ensure that there will be a space for veterans’ voices and interests in the campaign. Independence will create opportunities for veterans to engage in developing a fully democratic vision for Scotland’s future.

Why?  Because veterans have a vote and their voice needs to be heard in the debate. 

 Most importantly, it gives us a real opportunity to listen to other veterans, to hear why they might not be supporting independence just yet, and to set out what it might mean for them.

The point of it all? To persuade more Veterans and civilians in Scotland to support independence.

What We Need

We are a small group with a big message and we need your help to get it out:

  • Your donation will allow us to have a presence around the country.
  • Showing people that Armed Forces Veterans are not brainwashed Unionists.
  • Flyers, leaflets, badges raise the profile of the Independence message.

The Impact

Armed Forces Veterans are a growing demographic often ignored or mis-represented by the mainstream media

  • How a nation treats its Veterans is an important issue.
  • We can raise the profile of Independence
  • We can show the country that Veterans are not blind followers of the status quo.
  • Most importantly we can show the world that Scotland values the service of Armed Forces Veterans.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Come and see us at one of the many rallies that we attend.
  • Share, like and contribute to our Facebook page:
      https://www.facebook.com/VeteransForScottishInd...

And that's all there is to it.

Share, like and contribute to our Facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/VeteransForScottishInd...


And that's all there is to it.

story:
We’re going to wall off Trump's politics of hate in Cleveland, during the Republican Convention.

And it’s going to be beautiful. It’s going to be the best wall you’ve ever seen. And yes Mexicanos (and Latinxs and the conscious people of the US) are going to pay for it.

En español aquí

We’re calling on everyone who wants to live in a multi-cultural, multi-racial, peaceful, and prosperous America to rise up and join us in Cleveland. We’ll be there: organizers and artists, parents and kids, and direct action specialists who will not be silenced by Trump’s fear and hatred and xenophobia.  

Together we’ll be creating thousands of feet of beautiful wall: enough to encircle Trump's National Convention. Parts of our wall will be made of 4'x4' panels held by courageous activists working together to create a real physical wall against Trump.  Parts of our wall will be more symbolic, made of fabric, painted by artists (and kids) to look like a real wall. Parts of our wall will be gorgeous murals painted on structures, homes, and businesses throughout Cleveland. 

Our wall won't be the kind of wall that divides cultures and families. But a wall that brings us together to fight for a better future for our children.

Trump’s vision for our country is as small as his hands. His campaign slogan, “Make America Great Again,” is code to take our country back to a past of racial segregation. We’re not afraid of the future of this country. Instead, our wall will celebrate the beautiful potential our people hold.

We need to create 10,000 feet of wall. Please chip-in to be a part of this historic action.

PERKS!

*Important Perk Update*
The wall is underway!! Thanks to the generosity of so many donors, our amazing crew is busy putting the finishing touches on our YUUUGE wall. Since we're now in the painting phase, we will not be able to add any more names to the wall at this time. But all the other perks can still be claimed, so let's keep that total going up! Thank you to everyone who helped us reach our goal!

$2 - Downloadable Wall Off Trump Stencil

 

$15 - Go Home Donald, You're Drumpf Bumper Sticker
While you're navigating traffic, tell Donald exactly where he should go. 

 

$25 - "Migrant" Poster

Migration is beautiful. Hang this original artwork by Cesar Maxit in your home, office, or classroom as a reminder. 

 

$32 - Make America Mexico Again Hat

Get the infamous hat that flips Trump's slogan on its head. These hats went viral earlier this year, so if you missed your chance to grab one, get it now before they sell out again! 

 

$50 - Tuck Frump T-Shirts

Grab this shirt to be part of the team! You'll also get the bumper sticker!

 

$50 - "Migrant" T-Shirt

Even better than a poster! Snag this t-shirt featuring original art from Cesar Maxit to show it off wherever you go. You'll also get the bumper sticker!

 

$250 - Trump Piñata*

Get your name on the wall and snag a limited-run Trump Piñata. Perfect for barbeques or your next quinceañera!

*Piñata may not appear like the one pictured. It's used here to give you an idea. But it'll be great. it'll be beautiful. And you'll love hitting it.

 

$1,000 Ribbon Cutter
Donors at this level will make an enormous difference to this project, so you'll get the honor of being one of the people who cuts the ribbon when we break ground in Cleveland! You'll also get your choice of t-shirt.

story:
For over 30 years VOCA and The Healing Circle have been helping the survivors of child sexual abuse in Clatsop County.  They work tirelessly to make our community brighter, and help children heal, grow, and thrive.  In a normal year they would be putting on their VOCA camp right now. Since 1988 VOCA camp has been their yearly gathering where extensively trained and vetted volunteers share an experience giving both adults and children the best time of their lives with crafts and songs and tie-dye and everything great you would want from a camp- plus intentional safety and a powerful healing environment.  This year instead of cancelling camp because of Covid they are completely restructuring everything, designing a camp-in-a-box that they are delivering to the campers so that they know they are still deeply cared for, even in this time when we can not be together. In order to do this, they’re working as hard as they can- not just to get personalized, relevant, and timely services out, but also to be funded enough to do so. This is where they need your help.

Despite a lot of recent public interest in putting an end to child abuse, VOCA hasn’t seen an increase in donations or volunteers- and they’re currently serving more kids then ever.  Due to the unique strain of having to reformulate their camp, they need as much support as possible.  Please, help me support this incredible organization.  I have noticed commonly that when it comes to child abuse, people have no problem shaming those who definitely deserve to feel it.  However, I almost never hear people talk about what we do next, how we help those who have survived this experience.  This is what VOCA does, and it is both truly heroic and undervalued work.  If you agree we need to fight child abuse, then please help me focus on those in our community who are doing this often challenging work, and making our community brighter in the process.  Thank you.

story:
Fundraising drive for AGIR member defending his human rights!

Contribute to Edson Garcia’s Indiegogo fundraiser in order to help him to defend his right to equality without discrimination in housing!

As a gay Mexican immigrant, Edson was discriminated against due to his disability and being on social assistance. But WE can help Edson to defend his human rights by chipping in to cover the costs of his Judicial Review of the Quebec Human Rights Commission’s decision that rejected his case after conducting a very problematic investigation. Because of this problematic decision, Edson has retained support from CRARR, a local civil rights group, to help him go to court to obtain justice.

As a board member of AGIR and a leader within the queer refugee community, Edson needs our help – lets show him that as a community, we can support him in defending his human rights!

How can you help?

You can help by donating on this indiegogo page!

Our goal to cover the legal costs (i.e. court and bailiff fees, supplies, photocopies, etc) is $1,000 . Any costs we raise more than this will go towards CRARR's legal support services. Our goal for donations to CRARR is $ 1,000

Our total goal is: $ 2,000 ($200 extra will go towards paypal costs) 

Hopefully the PERKS we are providing will help people to donate! Any amount is appreciated! Some PERKS include: Photography taken and signed by Edson, any donation that is over $30 can be provided a charitable tax receipt, Any donation over $50, will receive the AGIR-Mapping Memories short films DVD titled: Memories to Reality: Queer Refugees in Montreal.

Background

In July 2011, AGIR Board Member and Photographer Edson Garcia was refused an apartment in a housing co-op located in the Gay Village. After Edson became a member of the co-op, the board of directors refused Edson’s application during the housing allocation process. One co-op board member claimed that Edson was refused due to aggressive behaviour during the selection interview. Edson disagrees with this claim and believes that the co-op disregarded the fact that he was diagnosed with a psychological condition which under the Charter, is a form of mental handicap, a ground of prohibited discrimination. Furthermore, Edson possesses evidence that one reason for the denial of his housing application is his being on social assistance at the time, even though he could meet his rental obligations as a future co-op member.

The human rights commission dismissed Edson’s complaint after conducting an investigation that, among other things, failed to examine the co-op’s record of renting to people with disabilities, which is non-existent.

In his desire to protect his civil rights, Edson has decided to file a judicial review of the Commission’s decision because of serious errors of fact.

Fortunately, the Centre for Research Action on Race Relations (CRARR) has decided to assist Edson. CRARR is a non-profit civil rights organization committed to promoting racial and other forms ofequality by supporting victims of discrimination through activities involving advocacy, research and legal representation. Each year, CRARR supports and assists over 250 victims of discrimination.

Edson’s Judicial Review involves major costs and fees that usually discourages people with limited income from accessing justice in Quebec (court and bailiff fees alone are almost $300; photocopies and supplies can easily cost $150). CRARR has very kindly taken on Edson’s case at practically no costs (pro bono), but it would be great if we could fundrais to help support Edson with his case. This would go towards the cost of the judicial review and provide a small donation to CRARR and its partners for its research and other services.

Edson joined the AGIR board at our last AGM in July 2011 and since then, he has tirelessly been involved in numerous AGIR initiatives. Today a full-fledged citizen, Edson has used his experiences as a gay Mexican refugee to support other LGBTQ refugees. He was also involved with AGIR’s anti-deportation campaign of gay refugee from Mexico and is involved in our exploratory research project. He also attended a co-facilitated a workshop on behalf of AGIR at a recent Canadian Council for Refugees (CCR) consultations. Edson is such an important part of the AGIR community and we know that by supporting Edson in asserting his human rights, that he will continue to support and organize with LGBTQ newcomers with AGIR.

story:
International Symposium against Isolation

For 12 years now, the International Platform against Isolation is organizing international symposias in different countries of Europe, in order to bring together movements, solidarity campaign groups, NGO's, intellectuals and people of all nationalities on the base of struggle against Isolation.

This project was brought to life in the long period of resistance against prison isolation, which had been continued by the political prisoners in Turkey over 7 years in total, defending their human rights with long term hunger strikes (death fasts).

Also hear an amazing song produced by Irish protest singer Pol Mac Adaim, dedicated to the resistance in F-type jails in Turkey: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x2QB-7TF8HU

It was very obvious that isolation was not only a policy used behind the prison walls, but also as a means in the world outside to silence system critical voices.

Our symposias therefore dealed with isolation in a larger context, from the prisons to the struggle of social and political movements, from media censorship to the occupations, blockades and war crimes in many parts of the world.

Our first aim is to create and coordinate the solidarity and unity among the peoples and organizations, to promote the efforts or common actions on international level and to built up thematical groups, as for instance exchange between progressive lawyers, the relatives of prisoners in different countries and also between political prisoners themselves.

We have organized already 11 symposias, being joined by wonderful people from all continents, building a bridge between intellectuals, artists and political activists for a common goal: Struggle for human dignity, freedom and justice.

While our earlier symposias were held in Noordwijk (Holland), Florence (Italy), Paris (France), Vienna (Austria), Brussels (Belgium), London (UK), Athens (Greece), Berlin (Germany) and Amsterdam (Holland), we decided this time to move towards the Arab world, namely to Beirut in Lebanon.

We want to come closer to the heart of the conflict to discuss with peoples of the region about our role to support the people in their tragedies of life, which were brought by the wars of profit.

To realize all this, means a lot of costs. There are many groups and persons involved, mainly from economically weak regions. This means huge travel expenses, infrastructure as meeting place, translation equipment, hosting, food and many others.

We always tried to find a way to manage, but in these times it's getting harder to find support. The fact, that the location of our symposias is changing every year, makes it even more difficult to get stable funds.


Here is the programme of the Symposium:



Dates of Symposium:

Thursday, 26th 27th and 28h of February/ 1st March 2015
Venue: Beirut-Lebanon / UNESCO Building


SCHEDULE


PROGRAM DRAFT FOR THE INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM

Beirut: February 26th - March 1st, 2015


Thursday, February 26, 2015:

10:00 a.m.-11:00 a.m.
Opening/Reception


11:00 a.m – 12:00 a.m.

Exhibition of the products made by political prisoners

12:00 a.m.-2:00 p.m.
ISOLATION POLITICS AGAINST INDIVIDUALS:
Political prisoners

2.00 p.m. - 3:00 p.m. Lunch break


3:15 p.m. - 4:15 p.m.

Different form of Isolation drawn by Imperialism:
Disappearances and Refugee Politics

break

4:30 p.m.- 06:00 p.m.
PANEL DISCUSSION:
Peace and war in the Middle East (Arab World)

- ISIL
- Does there a revolution take place in Rojava?
- What is the role of Imperialism for the happenings in Syria?
- The role of Turkey in the Middle East (Arab World)


6:00 p.m.- 06.45 p.m.

Dinner


7:00 p.m.- 7:30 p.m.

Continuation: Questions and answers


Friday, February 27, 2015:


9:30 a.m. - 11:30 a.m.
ISOLATION AGAINST POLITICAL MOVEMENTS / ORGANISATIONS
- There was put a reward of 3 millions of Dollar for each of 3 revolutionaries. Repression of anybody, who is resisting against USA.
- How far do the anti-terror lists of imperialism bind us?
- Extreme exapmles of the misuse of the anti-terror-lists:

*4 persons who were selling Grup Yorum concert-tickets will be charged

in Germany now

*How Imperialism will use the attack against Charlie Hebdo as pretext for attacks against people


Break


12:00 a.m.- 1:30 p.m.
The International Struggle and what we can learn from each other:
LATIN AMERICA
1:30 p.m. - 2:30 p.m.Lunch


2:30 p.m. -4:15 p.m.
ISOLATION AND INTERVENTIONS AGAINST COUNTRIES:
Ukraine, Iran, Cuba, Venezuela, Russia, Syria, Palestine…



4:30 p.m. - 6:15 p.m.
International Struggle and what we can learn from each other:
EUROPE

Turkey:
-Kazova resistance
-Center for struggle and liberation against drugs independency (H.F.G.)
-Struggle of Revolutionary Lawyer’s (People’s Law Office/CHD)
-Popular projects of the Engineers and Architects of the People…


6:15 p.m. - 6:45 p.m.Dinner


7:00 p.m. - 7:30 p.m.
Continuation: Questions and answers


Saturday, February 28, 2015:


9:00 a.m. - 10:45 a.m.
International struggle and what we can learn from each other:
AFRICA and ASIA

Break


11:00 a.m.- 12:45 p.m.
International struggle and what we can learn from each other:
How can we build up the anti-imperialist struggle?
How can we unite the resistance?

1:00 p.m. - 2:00 p.m.Lunch break

2:00 p.m. - 3:15 p.m.
International struggle and what we can learn from each other:
Continuation of discussion..

3:30 p.m. - 5:00 p.m.
Working on the final declaration

5:00 p.m. - 5:30 p.m.Dinner

6:00 p.m. - 10:00 p.m.
Concert



Sunday, Mart 1, 2015:


09.00 a.m – 08.00 p.m.

Round trip

The trip will begin in the centre of Beirut.


-First we will go to the South of Lebanon.

Our first stop will be the „MARTYRES SQUARE“ IN „Sayda“.

This square was made in memory for those, who were fallen in the 1980 in the war against Israel.


-After a short commemoration we will continue our trip to Mleeta (Open Air Museum).

story_txt:
International Symposium
against Isolation

For 12 years now, the
International Platform against Isolation is organizing international
symposias in different countries of Europe, in order to bring
together movements, solidarity campaign groups, NGO's, intellectuals
and people of all nationalities on the base of struggle against
Isolation.

This project was brought
to life in the long period of resistance against prison isolation,
which had been continued by the political prisoners in Turkey over 7
years in total, defending their human rights with long term hunger
strikes (death fasts).
Also hear an amazing song
produced by Irish protest singer Pol Mac Adaim, dedicated to the
resistance in F-type jails in Turkey:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x2QB-7TF8HU

It was very obvious that
isolation was not only a policy used behind the prison walls, but
also as a means in the world outside to silence system critical
voices.

Our symposias therefore
dealed with isolation in a larger context, from the prisons to the
struggle of  social and political movements, from media censorship to
the occupations, blockades and war crimes in many parts of the world.

Our first aim is to create
and coordinate the solidarity and unity among the peoples and
organizations, to promote the efforts or common actions on
international level and to built up thematical groups, as for
instance exchange between progressive lawyers, the relatives of
prisoners in different countries and also between political prisoners
themselves.

We have organized already
11 symposias, being joined by wonderful people from all continents,
building a bridge between intellectuals, artists and political
activists for a common goal: Struggle for human dignity, freedom and
justice.

While our earlier
symposias were held in Noordwijk (Holland), Florence (Italy), Paris
(France), Vienna (Austria), Brussels (Belgium), London (UK), Athens
(Greece), Berlin (Germany) and Amsterdam (Holland), we decided this
time to move towards the Arab world, namely to Beirut in Lebanon.

We want to come closer to
the heart of the conflict to discuss with peoples of the region about
our role to support the people in their tragedies of life, which were
brought by the wars of profit.

To realize all this, means
a lot of costs. There are many groups and persons involved, mainly
from economically weak regions. This means huge travel expenses,
infrastructure as meeting place, translation equipment, hosting, food
and many others.

We always tried to find a
way to manage, but in these times it's getting harder to find
support. The fact, that the location of our symposias is changing
every year, makes it even more difficult to get stable funds.Here is the programme of the Symposium: Dates of
Symposium:
Thursday,
26th
27th and 28h of February/ 1st  March 2015Venue:
Beirut-Lebanon / UNESCO Building SCHEDULE

story:
First Mind Outreach, Inc.

Homeless Transitional Rehabilitation Center

 

“Learning How To Trust Your First Mind”                        

 

"Am I my brother's keeper?"

 

We should think of ourselves as brothers and sisters who keep watch over each other. When we need care, our arms are wide open to embrace whomever is in need. We believe in maintaining your integrity, dignity, and pride as you transition through life. Although helping one another is Biblical, it comes naturally at FIRST MIND OUTREACH.

  

“Charity begins at home; but should not end there.”

            -Unknown

 

“If you have not any charity in your heart; you have the worst kind of heart troubles.”

            -Bob Hope

 

“Charity sees the need, not the cause.”

            -German Proverb quotes

 

“Charity and pride have different aims, yet both feed the poor.”

            -Unknown

 

Mission

 

First Mind Outreach was founded on the beliefs of giving and charity (love).

Research shows that most homeless people are without because of their need to have an address and means of communication. Oftentimes, the drug habits, mental states, and financially deprived are overlooked. We have come to recognize those very simple needs and orchestrated a program within our center to supply those needs to transition our fellow homeless citizens back into a workforce thriving society, with quality living and a life of hope and love.

First Mind Outreach is not a shelter, but a place to call home until the program is completed successfully, and the transition is in fact, substantial for both client and First Mind Outreach. Our mission is not over estimated, but reasonable.  We will in fact not be able to help everyone, for the poor we shall have always, but we will help, and help we must do.

With the help or volunteers, givers, donations, gifts, and helping hands, we can reach a vast number of men, women, families, and refugees to change the lives of many.

 

Housing

 

First Mind Outreach is designed to provide temporay housing for its clients in gender designated rooms, and living quarters for families living together.

The program is designed for standard living, from one month to one year (extension of six month max, if needed).  This program is catered to those clients who are not in need of drug rehabilitation, but in need of a place to live until they are self-sufficient. 

Advocacy programs are available through various government agencies, and local non-profit organizations and advocacies to assist with job placement, living assistant, clothing, and counseling.

Tenants who are required to participate in any of the drug rehabilitation programs are required to stay a mandatory six month to complete the drug course, before transitioning into the advocate assistance program.  It is instituted for the protection of the client to ensure that his/her transition is not encumbered, and to help him/her overcome their addiction(s), and give the necessary tools and mind set to live an addiction(s) free lifestyle.  This program is implemented with a Faith Based Belief (non-denominational) to increase chances of self-sufficiency, creating inner hope, determination, and self-preservation.

 

Volunteer Work

 

There's no greater joy than hands on work from volunteers. 

First Minds Outreach supports any and every volunteer in our programs: counselors, medical assistants, advocates, care givers, donators. We commend the dedicated volunteer work of fellow citizens,for sharing their time and going beyond the call of duty to extend a helping hand, a word of encouragement, a gift of love to anyone that’s in need, whether within First Mind Center, any charitable organization, or just random act of kindness.  We want the volunteer experience to be a memorable life changing experience  for our clients and volunteers alike.

 

Fundraiser

Help us reach our goals and join us on our journey to make First Mind Outreach not just a local organization but a national institute to help major cities, starting in Atlanta, where homelessness is an issue.  Our goal of $50,000 is to purchase the basic needs for the center’s living quarters to make our clients feel as much as home as possible, along with the basic needs of the company to run more proficiently and operatively so that our clients can receive the quality hands on treatment that they so deserve: 

Beds & Bedding                     Computers                             Furniture

Kitchen Supplies                    Toiletries                                Desk

Office Supplies                      Cleaning Supplies                  Electronics

Class Supplies                       Utilities                                              

 

Fundraiser money will be used to purchase items needed for the center and to also hire the four employees for administration.  Most of the work is designed for in-house clients and volunteers to perform such as counseling, sanitation, and up keep of the center.  Food and clothing is needed as well, but is asked to be donated to the center. All donations will be itemized to ensure that every client receives the proper benefits needed.  

Our desire is to insure that everyone, in need, will have the necessities for survival coupled with the training and skill set needed to survive on their own.

Become a helping hand to those in need. Help us help you reach out to those who are in need.  Each donation is documented and shown on our website.  No donation is too small; no contribution is too little.  Everything that is given can be and will be used to transition each and every client we receive in our center. 

We appreciate your monetary donations.

Feel free to come by and give a hand, a word of encouragement, a thought of love, and experience what it means to give.

We are a non-profit organization and each donation is tax deductible. 

Let First Mind Outreach be your volunteer home. Come be a part of something amazing!  

We offer housing and skill set to transition from homeless to a functional working class citizen.

 

Website: firstmindoutreach.org

Email: firstmindoutreach@yahoo.com

Phone: 404-809-1020

story:
FINAL UPDATE:

A HUGE thank you to everyone who donated in support of the campaign to defeat Colorado's Amendment 67, the personhood amendment.  

Here's how things ended up yesterday.  We raised enough money to reach a hundreds of thousands of people online. As a result, Amendment 67 was defeated, 63% to 37%. This is a huge victory for all of us.

Thank you for your support.  For those of you expecting perks, we are now switching our focus from defeating Amendment 67 to getting you all the love you deserve. 

A big huge sunny thank you from Colorado!


Update on The Campaign -- 10/28/2014:

We are one week and $11,000 away from our goal! 

Thank you for the donation. Our polling shows us that we are moving people to vote no with our education, but we cannot back down. 

Help us reach our goal! Dig into your pockets a little deeper and give a second gift. This week is the final push and the money raised will make sure this amendment gets defeated. We know that not everyone can give again, so any love on social media would be appreciated too.

Thank you for being your awesome self and working to defeat all abortion in Colorado! 

Also  . . . 

With one week to go, we are announcing our awesome tshirt design! This shirt is yours with a donation of $250!! (Just another reason to give.)


Update on The Campaign -- 10/20/2014:

Here's a quick update on how things are going in Colorado as we fight Amendment 67.  

There were plans to do an ad buy on Hulu to run the ad below.  The ad, called Amanda's Story, features a rape survivor who opposes Amendment 67 because she relied on emergency contraception after her rape.  Amendment 67 would ban emergency contraception.


Hulu has refused to run this ad claiming it is too controversial. Read the the full story of the No on 67 campaign's attempts to get Hulu to run this ad. 

A coalition of groups--the same coalition raising money as part of this Indiegogo campaign--have launched a campaign asking Hulu to reverse their decision and let Amanda's voice be heard.  The campaign is #HuluLetHerSpeak.

Now more than ever we need to raise money to reach our $40,000 goal so we can get Amanda's story out to voters through channels other than Hulu.  We can't let this censorship of important voices opposing Amendment 67 win out.  
Thank you to everyone who is supporting us right now as we battle each day to get voices heard in the fight to defeat Colorado's terrible Amendment 67. 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Colorado's Story:

All across the country, women are fighting for control of their own bodies and to make their own choices.  Access to birth control.  Safe, legal, accessible abortion options.  The ability to decide when, and if, to have children.  Basic rights that are under constant attack these days.  

Nowhere is the battle fought harder--or more often--than in Colorado.  Personhood USA, the leading group in the country working to ban all abortion by giving rights to a fertilized egg, is based right here in Colorado.  Every two years they put a “Personhood” measure on our ballot to amend the Colorado Constitution to give legal rights to fertilized eggs.  The “Personhood” measure—this year known as Amendment 67—would ban all abortion.  Even in cases of rape and incest.  Even when the life of the mother is at risk.  Amendment 67 would also ban many common forms of birth control.  It would require criminal investigations into any birth other than a live birth; miscarriages would be invested by police.  A pregnant woman with cancer would be denied access to life-saving medical treatment. 

Every two years Colorado women and men fight back against these harsh attacks on women’s rights. And two years later Personhood USA comes back with even more deceptive language to try ban all abortion in Colorado.

Why We Need Your Help:

Polling shows that if the election were held today, Amendment 67 would pass and Colorado would face the harshest restrictions on women’s rights in the country. 

Personhood USA has gotten more savvy each year they bring their “Personhood” measure forward.  They only talk about “protecting the lives of pregnant women”.  The ballot language is confusing and misleading--and right now it is working.  

Which means we MUST reach each and every voter in Colorado and educate them about what Amendment 67 would really do. Ban all abortions. Outlaw common forms of birth control. Criminalize women.

We can’t let this happen.  We need you to chip in now.

Your donation will go directly toward reaching targeted voters in Colorado with a creative digital campaign. The time and effort to create this campaign, the content that needs developed, and the money to get it in front of people—costs money.  That’s where you all come in.  Anything from $5 to $5,000 helps.  We are a scrappy team, and we will make the most of it.  

This is our state. These are our lives.  We will fight hard to defeat Amendment 67 and send Personhood USA a strong message that these attacks on women’s rights won’t work in Colorado, and they won’t work in any other city or state across the country.

This same coalition came together in 2008 and again in 2010 to defeat previous attempts to give fertilized eggs rights in the Colorado Constitution.  We know we can do it again. This time though, it’s different. This time the fight is harder. That’s why we’re reaching out all across the country and asking for your help.

Who We Are:

This year, a coalition of groups including Planned Parenthood Votes Colorado, NARAL Pro-Choice Colorado, COLOR (Colorado Organization for Latina Opportunity & Reproductive Rights) and ProgressNow Colorado Education are working together to raise money to defeat Colorado’s Amendment 67.  

We are coming together here in Colorado to defeat this dangerous measure.  We could really use your help.

Why Us:

Planned Parenthood Votes Colorado is a leader in protecting and advancing women’s reproductive rights in Colorado.  

NARAL Pro-Choice Colorado leads in Colorado in fighting for every women’s rights to make personal decisions.   

COLOR (Colorado Organization for Latina Opportunity & Reproductive Rights) provides a voice on reproductive rights and health perspective from within the Latino community, for the Latino community.

ProgressNow Colorado Education is the recognized leader for digital campaigns in Colorado. 

Vote No 67 is the campaign working to defeat Colorado’s Amendment 67.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Spread the word:  Share this campaign on your Facebook page, your Twitter feed, and with your friends and family through email.  Education is important.  We need the country to know about the fight we’re waging in Colorado.

story:
Emergency Funds for Colombian War Refugees and their Farm

$5,000 urgently needed to cover rent on organic farm project -- or non-profit that supports refugees will lose it

Your support will help war refugees and New Horizons foundation (who spearheads this amazing project) in these ways:

  • keep their cooperative farm
  • sell organic produce + eggs wholesale
  • ultimately, allow these wonderful people (our friends!) a chance at a new life


Want to know more before supporting us?  
Please keep reading!  
You'll learn our story, our vision, and our financials, and will meet the friends behind this campaign.  We provide educational links about the war in Colombia as well.


OUR STORY

Some of the almost 5 million victims of guerrilla violence in the country are living in foundation New Horizons housing.  New Horizons secured this farm rent-free for six months. The plan?  Create a sustainable for-profit venture to subsidize the important non-profit work of the foundation.  This farm is on track to provide recurring, consistent income for the foundation so that victims of the ongoing violence in Colombia will always to have a safe haven.  All residents of New Horizons has been forced to leave their homes by the violence that continues to plague provinces across the entire country. Contrary to media coverage, the war on the FARC has calmed down, but the violent conflict is a daily reality for most Colombians outside of Bogota. Last year alone, more than 250,000 people were forced to leave their homes.



Colombia has endured almost five decades of civil war where more than four million people, mostly women and children, have been forced out of their homes. Seven years ago Marino Rivera, a former refugee, started the New Horizons Foundation. Since then, the Foundation has sheltered more than two thousand displaced families, offering them housing, food, clothing and guidance. The Foundation is based in Soacha, just south of the country’s capital, where it houses up to 50 people at any given time. Securing daily food is the Foundation’s biggest challenge. That is why we started a sustainable farming project.

The Farm

The Foundation was granted access to a 2 acre plot that had been abandoned by its previous owner. Through a lot of effort and hard work by Foundation workers, volunteers and displaced families, we have transformed the fallow land into a viable farm. We have de-weeded and plowed, fixed the house, and put in a canal. We built fences, tool shacks, pig stys, rabbit pens and two chicken coops. We have also acquired a few animals and seeds. We used the products of this first harvest to forge relationships with local business in demand of affordable organic produce and willing to help our cause. Now it’s time to scale this project!

Your funds will help us secure the land for another year, buy animals, feed, seeds and materials.With your help, we will buy 400 egg-laying chickens, onion, cilantro, pea and lettuce seeds.  We will also pay for the training of a displaced person to oversee the project.

 


The Plan

We want to use this farm in three interrelated ways:

 First, it will offer shelter the families that work the land.

 Second, it will contribute resources to the Foundation’s main house, both in produce and in cash. 

Lastly, we will use the farm as a space in which displaced families that wish to return to their rural lives can learn innovative agricultural techniques that they can apply and share elsewhere.

Once completed, the project will provide us with organic vegetables, milk, eggs, and free-range chickens and rabbits. We are already reusing most of the organic waste produced in the house as compost and feed in the farm, and we have plans to scale up their use through better equipment. We will have the help of a local agronomist who will be on staff training displaced persons on sustainable farming techniques and will make sure our own practices are completely sustainable. With your help, the farm will break even within six months and will start turning a profit within the first year.


About the Colombia New Horizons Foundation

Over the last seven years, the Colombia New Horizons Foundation has helped more than 3000 victims of Colombia’s armed conflict. Most of these people have been single mothers and their children. The Foundation was borne from the personal experiences of its founder, Marino Rivera, who was displaced by FARC guerrillas from his native city of Florencia in the south of the country, where he worked as a school administrator. He arrived to Bogotá, the country’s capital, without any support or money and was forced to panhandle and sleep in the streets. After a month of living in the streets, Marino found his way to a shelter where he stayed for six months, until it was closed by its director. Marino then decided to organize the other displaced persons there and to open a new shelter for themselves and the thousands of families that arrive every day to the city, dispossessed from their lands by the violence that wracks the country.

When he first started the Foundation, Marino rented two bedrooms and a single bathroom to be shared by up to 30 people. Today, the foundation is located in a four story house, with five shared bedrooms and bathrooms, and ample room for up to fifty people.

The Foundation offers displaced families temporary room and board, clothes, psychological support and legal guidance. The Foundation is sustained entirely through individual donations.

All services offered are absolutely free.

For more information visit our website or like us on Facebook


About the Colombian Conflict and its Victims

After more than five decades of war between guerrillas, right-wing paramilitaries and the national army, Colombia has one of the gravest humanitarian crises in the world. The generalized violence, massacres, threats and intimidation have forced between 4.5 and 5 million people from their homes, making it the country with the highest internally displaced population in the world, according to the UN.

Even though the paramilitary groups struck a deal with the government and demobilized in 2006, they have morphed into sophisticated drug trafficking organizations that continue to terrorize and displace thousand of civilians. Likewise, the guerrillas have sought to enter into peace negotiations with the Colombian government, but no cease fire has been declared, and in many regions the violence has escalated.

Last year, a quarter of a million people were displaced by the violence. They sought refuge in the country's larger cities and departmental capitals. Despite legislation aimed at providing displaced families with reparations, the state's aid network is not meeting the needs of these victims. Most of them struggle securing basic necessities, housing, food and health services. It is estimated that 85% of displaced Colombians live under conditions of extreme poverty.

For more information visit:

The UN Refugee Agency

Thompson Reuters Foundation - Colombia

keep their cooperative farm
sell organic produce + eggs wholesale

ultimately, allow these wonderful people (our friends!) a chance at a new life

story:
Short Summary

This initiative is part of a large scale project to design and create an acre sized encampment for Endview Plantation. This will serve as a new educational and interpretive area for the museum, allowing visitors, school groups, and camps to see both what an acre is and how a summer encampment for a company of infantry during the 1862 Peninsula Campaign would have looked. The primary focus of this fundraising effort is to acquire and donate a reproduction Wall Tent for the ‘Tent Row’ area, which will serve as the Captain’s Tent. The Enlisted area is almost fully populated with Wedge Tents and a single Sibley Tent, so the addition of a Wall Tent to the encampment will not only show visitors a glimpse of how officers lived compared to the other ranks, but illustrate a third type of Civil War Era tent as well.

In its overall outline, the encampment will be surrounded by a wattle fence, with a main entrance centered on the side facing the main house and an exit in a lower Company Area. A flagpole is located about dead center, and the path from the entrance make a left turn to reach the Tent area, passing a Kitchen Area. The Captain’s Wall Tent will then be on the visitor’s left, and a path immediately opposite its entrance will be the NCO and Enlisted men’s ‘Tent Row.’

What will be Funded

Funding will go towards the purchase of a reproduction Wall Tent for immediate donation to Endview Plantation.  Any money earned past the needed amount will be applied toward additional tents to further flesh out the encampment.  As this is a Fixed Funding effort, this effort will only happen if the minimum goal is reached.

[Edit, June 5, 2014]

 The initial goal of $500 has been met, and the Wall Tent is a go!  The next fundraising milestone will be at $725.  Once this additional $225 is raised, it will be enough to purchase a Sergeant's Tent for the encampment, adding another layer of interpretation to the site.  

The Impact

This effort will allow the encampment at Endview Plantation to truly begin to take shape.  Having a Wall tent will allow guests and campers to see how Officers lived in comparison to the Enlisted men, and increase the available areas for interpretation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let others know about this campaign, and be sure to visit the encampment's photo gallery at https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.277185479121330.1073741835.268874469952431&type=1, part of the Civil War Camp Education page https://www.facebook.com/endvieweducation.  Thank you again!
